Review: If you want to experience interactive activities with exotic animals this is is the perfect place for you.   You get to experience feeding the tiger, ostrich, koi and crocodiles. Even as an adult you will really enjoy this place. They also have a thrilling crocodile acrobat show and amusing bird show.   This place is a must visit in Davao. I find this place even more entertaining than zoos in other countries.
Better to go here during weekends so you can watch the Tribu perform at 6pm. There are different shows everyday. There's a petting zoo, fish feeding, ostrich feeding, etc.
When your at Davao. Don't miss the Crocodile Farm. 500 per person is advisable budget. Better go there with their scheduled show. What to Bring: 1. Water 2. Food 3. Camera

ReviewTitle: Great place to take the kids
Review: From feeding the swarms of koi to having you photo taken holding a python, to viewing the animals on display this is a great place to tke the kids.

Home of the famous "Pangil", a 18ft saltwater crocodile, which is now the biggest crocodile in captivity in the country after Lolong died. Aside from the crocodiles, you can see other rare animals which even I saw them for the first time. They also have feeding spots in some areas where you can interact with the animals. Check the shows before going there so you can watch them for free like the dancing crocodiles show and actual feeding time of Pangil.

ReviewTitle: A Davao Zoo treat for kids
Review: 45 minutes to 1 hour away from the City. A typical zoo but withseveral crodile ponds. Souvenir shop offers many products made of crocodile leather and some food outlets offer Crodile Ice Cream and meat store ha ve readily available choice crocodile meat. There are the usual exotic birds, primates and big cats. A good treat for kids.

Location: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Review: Great Parking. Not crowded place. You need waze or google map to go there as the place is quiet far from the city. Crocodile Park is a little smelly but my daughter enjoyed the experience.

The place is decadent. There is a giant crocodile in a small pool: I believe the animal even can move itself as the place is almost of its size. The smell is not good around the animals and lots of places are not well maintained (no animals inside, no information about the animals etc). I was sad there. Couldn’t enjoy. Poor animals... maybe the authorities should visit there and check if they are respecting the minimum principles to keep the animals there.

I am from Amsterdam/Netherlands and wat i have seen? A show with birds like eagles, a show with a monkey dresed like a child. The crocodiles have some space, but tigers and other animals are in too small caches. It is time to renovate the animal accomodations.
5pm good time for the crocoodile. Then go around and feedback fish and bird. And see all other birds and animals Then flame dance.
Cheap, loads of crocs, snakes, tigers and other animals, fish and birds to see. Kids and adults enjoyed it.
We had a great time observing the crocs and other animals, birds and fish. This is a fine place for adults and families.

I brought some of my friends here what a mistake. Animals are in cramped conditions with faeces everywhere. Unbelievable neglect and stench. Biggest crocodile left in a couple of inches of water too small to move around in. Crocodiles piled on top of each other...More

ReviewTitle: Exotic Zoo that served exotic food, must try!
Review: When you visit Davao, please do include this in your itinerary. You must try the exotic delicacies like the crocodile adobo, crocodile icecream, etc.

I can no longer remember when was the last time I went to a zoo and I was amazed to see different kinds of animals with different sizes and shapes. My friends and I was able to feed the ostrich and the crocodiles. It was...More

Interesting to note they have croc icecream. but luckily it was out of stock when we went, so we opted for an Ostrich ice cream instead. They had Bengal tigers as well as Bear cat which i had never seen before.
If you're a tourist this is worth a look. When I was there in 2001 it was all crocs in cement pools that never moved. Now it's a mini zoo that added a decent restaurant (despite being outside).
It's a place for all types of relationship. It's a great place for all ages! Everything that could happen will be magical to remember. TWO THUMBS UP!

We enjoyed this visit. Lots of crocodiles and you get to feed them. You have to buy the feeds, which are way overpriced but hey they need to make a profit, and you get to feed the crocs. They also have tigers and other wildlife.  I didn't give it an excellent rating cause they really need to clean up a bit and the staff are not that friendly and accommodating. They seemed bored and irritated. Go during the weekends for their show.

Nice sidetrip for animal lovers . Though area was not as big as I expected animal shows made up for it.   Take a Cab for Php 100 from city Center. Entrance fee is 300 pesos . There are food places within the area.Research on show schedule and come ahead of schedule since seats can fill up fast especially on week-ends.

ReviewTitle: Don't miss the fire show and the big crocodiles.
Review: This is the 2nd time I have been there, and this time I can see they have made alot of improvements. The animal show was good just watch out for the birds flying around, my daughter almost had a sea eagle fly into her. They have them flying back and forth to the trainers during the show also other birds do the same thing. There are many animals to see like lions,tigers which you can get up on the cat walk and watch the trainers feed them, also monkeys,philippine deer, big snakes, and a lot of strange looking birds. You can also hand feed the koi in this big pond they have but don't get to close because they just about come out of the water to get the food and there are hundreds of them. You can hold a croc or a big snake and take your picture if you feel like it. They also have a show with this huge croc, if you go stand up in front of his head because when he was turning back and fourth the people in the back by his tail were getting soaked from his thrashing around. The last thing you must see if you go is the fire show which start around dusk and is really awesome.

a great place for anyone who have a good heart for the wild. they have lots of exotic animals and they are being well taken cared of. just be sure to check their daily schedule of shows before going there since every day they have different shows.
Amazing attractions for any age guests. I even won a tickets for Zipline! Well trained, well maintained, clean and not hungry animals. Staff are supportive. Great for weekends with family or friends.

Amazing crocodile, bird and tiger show. Of them, crocodile show was the most thrilling. They showcase different animal species. Some are already endangered. They also have souvenir shop where you can buy different croc items among others.

ReviewTitle: Amazing Show! Still the best for us!
Review: This is the best place to learn about animals. Aside from crocodiles, there are numbers of rescued animals here and adopted animals here. The shows are amazing. Bird Show, Crocodile Dancing, Crocodile Feeding, Pangil Encounter, Animal Feeding and Photo Opportunity with the animals. This is the best animal encounter experience so far. The place is cool. Visited this place a lot of times and there is always something new every time...

i've been here two years ago and they have more exotic animals than before. more than just crocodiles, they also have boa constrictors, exotic birds, carps, tigers, lions, ostriches, giant turtles and a lot more. you also get to feed some of the animals, have photos taken with them and watch an exciting animal show. great wasy to spend time with kids and adults alike.

My boyfriend and I went here via cab, luckily, cab drivers in Davao doesn't say no! :D The park is inside a huge place, consisting of subdivision, making commute quite a challenge, as sometimes, you have to wait long for cabs to arrive. The park has an entrance fee of 250 PHP per head, (300 PHP when you arrive 2PM onwards) and you can re-enter as many times during your visit. The restaurant is outside (Riverwalk Exotic Grill) and serves good food and has a nice cultural show on weekends. I tasted the crocodile ice cream, which is made out of crocodiles' unhatched eggs and flavorings (Durian or Chocolate). Crocodile meat is also good and is a must-try when you visit the place.

I have been to Crocodile Park several times before, so it's nice to see that the park is developing. They have a whole range of animals in this park, obviously crocodiles, tigers, various types of birds, snakes, monkeys and turtles. They offer feeding of crocodiles (which I tried, I can recommend it), snake massage and other various animal shows. You can get real close to the animals, which is great if you like to take pictures, I even managed to sit right next to a giant turtle. The park is located out of the busy city core, so you need to ride a taxi to get there. There is restaurants and other small shops outside the park, so it's easy to get a descent meal and refreshments. If you're a traveling family I can recommend this park, I am sure your kids will have a great time there. And yes you can have a crocodile burger if that's your thing.

The large predators are in barred enclosures. Orange the orangutan only seems happy during the talent show. The reptile enclosures need cleaning as does most of the zoo. The zoo looks like it is in need of a facelift. The staff are friendly and seem to interact gently with the animals. You can feed chicken bits to tiger from above them. Just remember to think third world.
Compared to other zoos very average but not bad for kids. Daytime show for the kids and easy to see the crocs.
I went there last may with friends and the experience was awesome. The crocs were scary, some were big, medium sized crocs were there too and small ones!! Just great experience.
The place has a lot of crocodiles,,, like really a lot!! The place is well kept and maintained. Kids loved the place and just got really scared too hahahah!!

The bird show starts around 3PM. So better go here earlier to have a better seats. The entrance fee was so so. I enjoyed the bird show more than the crocodiles. Approximately 2 hours of spending here on a off peak days (weekdays) is enough for picture taking and selfies. The crocodile leather goods were soooo expensive!

Went here as im curious about this crocodile farm...from my hotel till here is about 20 mins trip and about 120 pesos fare in taxi. Entrance is 250 adult 150 kids  It was such a great day when i came about 10 am..no much people as its just a weekend...diff animals to see..  From birds, snakes, crocodiles, bat, turtles, ostrich , tiger, monkey, etc.  It was a fun filled morning for me..not only kids will enjoy visiting here but even adults.  They also hve some show in the afternoon but since i will go to eden nature park i skipped that. Nice place to relax esp if ull bring ur kids :)

This place has lots of animals but i think this park has seen better days. We visited the park on a friday and paid the weekend rate but the tour, although educational, seemed to be rushed. Some advertised animal shows did not happen (like the crocodile wrangler one) so i was kinda disappointed. But i liked the koi feeding and taking pictures with the statue of a giant crocodile. Overall i think it's fun to have kids enjoy this educational trip and for all visitors to learn a thing or two about animal and nature conservation.

Reptiles are caged at many places. There are many sizes of them and it is a real experience that you can get so near to them. A little foul smell but you can ignore it if you concentrate on the reptiles rather than the area

I've never liked the idea of caged animals. Well according to their manager they are a croc farm above all. And indeed they had hundreds if not thousands of crocs. All kinds, baby crocs, sea crocs, giant crocs, medium sized crocs, croc skin wallet, a few birds and there that were saved from poachers. It didn't have that zoo vibe to it, if you like feeding tigersand crocs this is the place for you, just not for me.

I was amazing!!! I fed the fish, tigers and crocodiles!!!! It was my first time to see a cobra too. Poor lonely lion, hope they put more in. There were lots of birds and some monkeys,, the show was funny and entertaining as well.

ReviewTitle: It will bring back the child you
Review: Learn and enjoy at the same time, the place is full or wonderful creatures that we don't usually see up close. This is definitely a place to go for family outing and even with friends. I live the tigers it is truly a majestic creature

Even though im old enough, going to a park never fails to satisfy me. It will make you go back to being young, you would appreciate every animals or reptile you see that you wont see everyday. A crocodile named "PANGIL" he was really huge! It was the most biggest crocs i have ever seen in my life, i was also able to experience to feed the tigers ang fish. It was really an amazing experience and an unforgettable one!

I swear ive been to crocolandia in Cebu and this place is more than that. There were so many animals. I was able to witness animals got talent as well. Its so amazing that they were able to train birds to fly, made crocodiles dance and tiger climb up the pole.

We stopped in on Sunday before catching a flight home. This place was well worth it. Lots of fun walking around and seeing wild animals and reptiles. You can even feed them. For me the highlight was standing on top of tiger cages, feeding them raw food. This place is a must visit if in davao...
well you can watch the crocodile in various sizes, they are bred inside the park there are birds snakes etc as other attraction, you can also taste the croc ice cream

I suggest going to Croc Park during the weekends and attending the talent show. We spent 1-2 hours there and the highlight would be feeding the animals. We also went during the weekdays and there were barely anyone there so it was easy for us to take photos of the animals without the crowds.  250 pesos entrance fee for adults.

We did see many crocodiles. Really I would call it a mini zoo. We did enjoy seeing all the animals. Having lunch there was the typical food not available on the menu with it being a crocodile zoo and it being on the menu, I thought I'd try it. Then let down not available. The shops in the park should put prices on all products, I felt like we where getting tourist prices.

ReviewTitle: Great place but fee is pricey
Review: Lesson learned - You have to allot at least half or more of your day to maximize the use of the Php 300 entrance fee. The place also lack of signs on how you will go around the park. We missed the butterfly garden because there is no direction how to go there or information that it is only open until 5PM. The program in the afternoon is entertaining though.

ReviewTitle: Fantastic Day at the Crocodile Park
Review: Gotta admit this was way cooler than I thought it was going to be. We had a blast here with young kids and I highly recommend seeing the Crocs and the Animals. You won't regret it. Xx

My in laws and I went here after our trip to Samal Island. If you want to see a lot of animals and interact with some then this place will not disappoint. You can feed tigers, ostriches, and koi here. Lots of opportunities for picture taking. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Premises are cleaned routinely. A must-visit if you are a party with kids.

I guess for security purposes there's Too much net on the cages to prevent visitors from feeding them but you can barely see the details of the animals. A barricade would have been better. Apart from that the place is ideal for group tours. They have tigers, birds, ostrich, turtles, reptiles, snakes, etc... I also like the feeding hours wherein visitors get the chance to experience how is it like to feed crocodiles and see them jump out of the water to grab the food.
Its a bit smelly, but i enjoyed taking lots of pictures.. They also have a mini museum for extinct species.. This is a good place for kids and kids at heart, very educational tour.

at 250 pesos you can enjoy three tours in one package, first you can enjoy the floral gardens in their Butterfly Garden which is about a-2 blocks away, then enjoy the main attraction in their Crocodile farm where you can see a lot of animals AND Crocodiles of variant sizes including their main attraction "PANGIL" the 18-foot croc. you can also see lots of other animals in here, like ostrich, tigers, snakes monkeys and other animals found only in the Philippines, after the tour you can enjoy native dishes from the Kamindanawan restaurant and enjoy some of the tribal music starting at 5:00 pm but only on weekends.
I really enjoyed to be here and I observed that they always make the area clean & friendly! This is good for everyone destination, :)
So much for the kids to see and do! If you have tone sign up for the white water rafting, its definitely an amazing adventure!

Family enjoyed very much, place is a Zoo with various animals, local and imported, huge area, animals are well taken cared of and not malnourished, seen a lot of caretaker in many cages working, feeding and cleaning, plenty of shades also even on a noontime visit. Can take pictures freely, some animals are in the open and not caged, mostly with companions and not a lone caged animal. Foods available inside the zoo, average comform rooms, clean and well maintained. Affordable since price covers 3-areas (zoo, butterfly farm, kamindanawan show) just make sure to check schedule of activities. Recommended place when in Davao!

Great place for kids to see nature, crocodiles and more, birds, monkeys, snakes and more. We had a wonderful time and stay for the live show it is worth it. We had so much fun and getting a chance to see and hold some just toped it off..

ReviewTitle: It was Ok. Good for those who have not been to big Zoos ;)
Review: Went there w my family...you wont expect that you will see other animals too. I thought only crocodiles:/ My mom n daughter enjoyed feeding the fish, it was just pity that the weather was not that nice to us. At the end of the day, they have this show which kids would love it.

There are more than just crocodiles here. The show they have here is a lot of fun. The grounds of the tigers are very small, yet because they have several of them, there are snakes, birds, monkeys and even bats ....
The entrance fee was quite expensive. Aside from seeing the crocodiles, there where feeding activities and it's additional fee for every feeding. It was an expensive sight seeing activity

We recently arrived in Davao and are finding our way around, so this morning we decided to check out the Crocodile Park. We were pleasantly surprised to find that this is actually a mini zoo. Of course there are crocs, lots of crocs, pens of different size groupings. But there are also some large pythons, ostriches, sheep, goats, ducks, geese, turkeys, deer, a few hawks and eagles, some monkeys and even a few tigers.  We even had the opportunity to feed a couple lambs and throw some fish food into a pond full of colorful koi.

Unless you need to entertain very young children the trip out to the Crocodile Park is a complete waste of time. There is an array of regional animals in poor conditions with a number of pools full of crocodiles of various sizes. It is designed for the selfie crowd.

We went to crocodile park late in the afternoon just in time for the Animal Show to which my daughter was very amazed. She really enjoyed watching the different birds and animals on the show. The family also enjoyed the petting zoo where you get to feed the baby sheep with milk, the rabbits with carrots and the ostrich with feeds. My daughter was scared during the tight rope show though. Overall the experience was great except that we went so late in the afternoon.

The name itself is deceiving. More than just crocodiles here. The show that they have here is pretty entertaining. The only negative thing i would have to say is that the enclosure for the animals are too small. Especially for the tigers and they do have several of them.
You need to be here before 4pm for the crocodile feeding and animal show. It's a place to visit if you will be touring around Davao. You can take photos with albino snake and crocodile.

I'm not an animal rights person but I have reservations about the well-being of the animals in this place. It seems they are all just there for show with no regard for their health and well-being. I hope they employ well-trained professional staff who love...More

This is a Zoo Park in Davao City where a variety of animals can be found. It has tiger, crocodile, snake, monkeys, bearcays, birds, and the likes. It also has an animal show which starts late in the afternoon. Souvenirs are also available inside same...More
Great place to visit and my second time here . Watch the shows and feel the warmth of the beautiful people of the Philippines
The zoo there is nice with a good variety. The feeding of the crocodiles is exciting. It is child friendly.

I was with my husband last March2017 in Crocodile Park.Very clean and friendly staff.Of course,hundreds of crodiles and other animals.It really improves alot since I visited 5yrs ago.Well done and keep it up for good service for every visitors👏😀❤️ Oh,must try for crocodile burger 😜👌

When you go Davao City, this place is one of your lists to visit in the city. The place is like a usual zoo in Metro Manila. But this part has an advocacy to save and rehabilitate the animals in Davao particularly the Philippine crocodiles....More

fantastic crocodile show too much people though would be good if the show is spaced apart to give you time to watch each one they have crocodile ice cream lots of mosquitoes though so bring insect repellant

If you want to get away from all traffic and noise for a while then this is a great place to visit. They have of course a lots of different crocodiles but also some other animals to see. There is a ok souvenir shop and...More

this place has a lot of attractions. you can feed ostriches, see a really huge croc. wasnt too bad.   but the crowd was not ideal. we attended one of the shows; the host would have been funny but his punch lines were marked with canned laughter and sound effects you hear on the radio stations for jeepney drivers.   would not go back.

We visited the Crocodile Park on a morning outing in Davao. The park is interesting with many species to be seen. The highlight was the chance to feed the crocodiles in one of the enclosures. There are many great photo opportunities around the park, nicely laid out with specific suggestions of the best angles. All in all we enjoyed our brief visit to the crocodile park. Kids will find the park interesting and informative.

ReviewTitle: Educational Trip even for the Young Once!
Review: Visited the place with friends. Also good for students on educational trips.  The park is mostly packed out with people in the afternoon. If you don’t want, go there in the morning which we did. But we stayed until later in the afternoon because I was waiting for an animal show inside the park and cultural show located beside the park. But I got tired from walking and wasn’t able to wait for the shows. So we left.  There are some crocodile quarters which are really crowded and some are not. But it’s not only crocodile you can see there. Lots of animals too! You have to buy food for the animals in order for them to move. We bought fish food for the koi’s. We feed them. Really weird the koi’s eating in your hand and exciting too! I really pity the tiger which is housed in a fitted cage. The tiger cannot move comfortably even.   There are souvenir shops and restaurants on the other side which serves crocodile sisig and crocodile lechon (which both aren’t available at that time) so we settled for crocodile ice cream instead. Taste like pistaschio ice cream and you can eat bits of nuts (but it’s not nuts) which I think is the crunchy crocodile. My friend was figuring out his ice cream when he suddenly spit crocodile skin and there are some scales included. Must try… Yummy!

ReviewTitle: a must visit place in davao
Review: this is a good place to visit while in davao; you will see variety of animals not just crocodiles. we really had a fantastic experience here

It bears a name where you would have an idea only crocodile would be seen but you'll be sruprised they have other animals there. It's basically a zoo. Ticket price was 250 each and that would include entry to the croc park, tribuhan, and butterfly garden. The place is very nice, there are a lot of trees so even if you are there in the middle of the day, it is shady. They have animal shows in the afternoon featuring their best trained animals. There is only one place you can buy food. It was situated at the exit.

ReviewTitle: A lot better than what i expected
Review: The show was quite interesting with monkeys, crocodiles and other animals doing tricks. The dinner at the restaurant was delicious, serving crocodile meat. The fire show during dinner and the local Visayan entertainment was enjoyable too.

As the name implies, the place has lots of crocodiles of all sizes from baby crocs to adults. There's even a life sized replica of Lolong and some tigers in small cages. There's a monkey show on the day of our visit.

ReviewTitle: Kind of wild that show with crocodiles
Review: That show too hang a piece of meat and the crocodile "dances" is so wild. Every creature if hungry would act as in instinct to eat. Just as a cat tries to catch something that hopes to get in their mouths at the end of the day.Look back at the history and see how other nations took advantage of hungry people in prisoners camp and then think if is fair to laugh when a creature that is captive fighting for its food! Second, that fire show is very nice.Good job!  But the restaurant above just take advantage of the tourist attractions and adds fees and the price is just like talking advanced of your hunger so ad the crocodiles does an effort and "dances " then you too must "dance " in your wallet.If service would be good and nice smiling faces that asks you if anything is OK, time to time, then...I'll dance , otherwise, no way to get back there.
Traveled the park in a day and I had alot of fun. Got to see many things up close and i would recommend this to everyone.
I got goosebumps upon seeing those green eyed monsters! Seeing them that many was overwhelming. You have to see their bird show as they feature animals with amazing talents!

Going to the crocodile park was about 30 minutes from the city central. the entrance fee was 300 pesos which we did not expect when we came because it's not exactly cheap. But when we went in, it definitely was worth it and I think...More

ReviewTitle: Very fun place for family or friends
Review: Gotta visit if you visit! Go on feeding Sunday! They also have a great show before they go for feeding time. I have never seen the size of the gator they have ever!

When you visit the Crocodile park you should know in advance the schedule of their shows, as they have enjoyable shows in this park. And you also get to see those gators at their feeding time, as well as there are other species that you...More

I went with my brother and sisters. We enjoyed a lot there were a lot of crocodiles and other animals like ostrichs and owls which were kept their and we also had snake on our neck it was so scary to see but it was...More

Kids loved the big cat feeding with the New Tigers in the park. The largest crocodile Pangil had finally shown half his head and we marveled at his hugeness. Our best experience had to be being around free range sheep, ostrich, chickens and ducks and...More

We arrived late so most of the activities there were unavailable. But the place was good. However, we had a hard time going home from there cause if there are no available taxi, you have to walk a long way or ride a habal-habal(?). Sana...More
crocodile park is very far away from most things but its worth the time going there ,but try to leave before it gets dark there are not many taxis around ,but they will call a taxi if needed
Went with my partner, wasn't busy and only $8 taxi from the city, plenty of crocodiles from all sizes and plenty other animals which was pretty interesting
Their show with parots and monkeys was fun. They have lot of crocodiles of different sizes. The place is definitely good for families with children.

Visiting this place makes me more excited to eat a croco icecream. With my kids and my mother, they find it more adventurous and exciting. Aside from ciewing the live croco the landscape worth a souvenir shots.

This is a must see park in Davao for all ages including disabled people though park needs to add restrooms accessible to wheelchair bound folks. Must try crocodile meat menu in one of their restaurants

first....its a little bit far from the center of the city you should come early so that you can enjoy the place better since some are coming by groups the bird show is really enjoyable theres a souvenir shop.....and an ice cream parlor beside the...More

ReviewTitle: Still one of top tourist spots in Davao!
Review: It was fun seeing crocodiles of many forms and sizes. It felt great watching them dance. It was a spectacular feeling witnessing their battle over food - scary but awesome. The place is great for people of all ages, especially the kids. The bird show...More
Clean, organized, friendly staff. There was a bird show when we visit and delighted us esp the kids. The Crocodile Ice Cream is a must-try!!!

The reason I gave this review a lower rating is because when we arrived about 5:30 PM, it's aleady getting dark and of course reptiles are more active during the day.It's not the fault of the park, but they should change their closing time to...More

They'll tell you up to class 4, but even with the water up a little I didn't see anything above class 3 (from my prospective), would make a good family adventure ... good over all experience and would definitely recommend the trip if already in...More
One of the beautiful place in Davao, visitors can interact with the animals like photo shoot with snakes, and crocodiles, also feeding the fish and ostrich. Best experience with the kids.

ReviewTitle: It's like a little zoo with mostly crocodiles
Review: The crocodile park has several pens with crocodiles but I've seen bigger commercial types with many more. You can try the crocodile sisig here. It's strangely tasty. There are also many aviaries with many species represented.  The park is famous for their white water adventure, which is something like a theme park ride in actual nature (fun), and their famous fire dancer shows on Friday and Saturday nights (reputedly excellent though I didn't get to see it).
DAVAO croc park is better than singapore zoo, heaps more interactive with guides etc.. great place to walk round , hawkers near by , nice place ... sept 2014

ReviewTitle: One of the best parks in the Philippines!
Review: One of the best parks in the Philippines. Worthy of your time. They have their own version of animal show during Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Very educational! They also offer animal feeding-- fish, crocodiles and tiger!

Omg there were a lot of crocodiles all over the place but they didn't move them selfs. Just like a lot of dead animals. Yes there are few other species but nothing that catches your eyes or made you feel like there was a life there. A big disappointment for us.

The crocodile Park is not only a kids paradise of wonders, but for all ages. It will amaze you. You see various local birds, animals like the tiger. And off course you get to see the crocodiles being feed. Want to check out your nerves? Try holding a snake while someone tries to take a picture. Word of caution stay calm while the snake moves around your body. Ok now you have graduated from this, now the final check. Holding a baby crocodile. Now that you have done screaming & kicking cool your throat with crocodile ice cream. They have free WiFi. You are so tried & hungry try the crocodile fried rice and sauted crocodile.  Beware the fried rice is not a small potion it's huge. Have fun!
Felt sorry for the animals caged in concrete but it may be a personal preference. Lots of variety of animals not just crocodiles.

But of course the animals have too few space.  I had ice cream made of crocodile eggs and could hold a lemon colored snake.  They have shows for the trained animals. They advise the customers to keep the country tidy and not to throw things in the landscape. Good idea, but people that can afford the entrance fee should already have some basic socialization.

Went here solo as part of a pre-arranged city tour. Entrance is Php 250.00/head.   Not much to see except for... drum rolls... crocodiles. LOL! like hundreds of them.   Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the place. There was a mini zoo, with animals I have only seen for the first time and names of which I don't even remember (haha, so that may not make this a good review, right? LOL!)  Anyway, there is an area here where you can feed the fish, an ostrich, or a tiger. I fed the fish, haha!   There is a souvenir shop that sells souvenirs from Php 50 (ref magnets, key chains, and the like) up to Php 2,000+ (croc skin thingies). Yes, I got a ref magnet ;)  Just outside the shop, there are food kiosks, so no need to worry about getting starved. I went straight to the Croc Egg Ice Cream Shop. I dd not know what to expect from a 90-peso croc egg ice cream... but I sure don't regret getting one. It's different in that is is more "malinamnam" than the regular ice cream. Other than that, nothing different, scary, or gross. :) Thank heavens!

I went there to see crocodiles and you know what, when I saw those crocodiles I just got scared of those because those were really scared and I was little bit in fear and more in joy for taking selfies with them hehee... Interior is like adventurous place so adventure lover must try having a trip there..

ReviewTitle: Had a blast with my son!
Review: The park is well-maintained, very clean and as my son said "its not stinky here as the other animal parks!" We enjoyed the crocodiles and seeing the baby crocs are separated from the bigger ones. We didn't get to see a show as there were only few people inside the park but that's ok. The cages of the tigers are very small! Hope they do something about that. Tigers should have a HUGE open space for them. The bats were a bonus for us as we never get to see bats in any animal parks. Love the little shops outside and cafes. My first time to try croc ice cream and croc sisig and surprisingly, it is good!! The meat of a croc is tough so if you don't like chewing a lot before you swallow your food, better not try it.

ReviewTitle: An afternoon with nature and grandkids at Crocodile Park
Review: The trip is exciting, for me and for the grandkids. We see lots of crocodiles in their own habitats, aside from the exotic birds and other animals. This is a very nice place for the children and for students excursion from elementary to college. And even old folks who have no chance to see these places while young. Welcome to Crocodile Park, where you can see bags and accessories made of crocodiel skin and even taste the menu with croco meat ingredients. Try it ! .

Went here on a Monday in November 2015 There are usually no shows on a Monday, luckily there is a field trip of preschool students. So we also enjoyed the animal show. I do not remember the name of the host but he is great! There are a lot of Crocodiles (of course), birds, snakes, and other animals. This is worth our time.

I loved the well-organized shows. The place is clean and there are also other animals there, other than crocodiles. They offer free shuttle services to the highway but you can also call a cab to get you from the park to your desired location.

Growing up in Davao, i always heard about this place and actually got tired of it. But this park just has its way in finding more attractions for guests to enjoy whether local or international tourist. It is in my opinion, a tourism icon of Mindanao.

I've been to Crocodile Park in Puerto Princesa, Palawan and it had been a learning experience for me and my friends and I was expecting just the same routine with the crocodile park in Davao, but I was amazed with the different experience that we had.  Though the area is far from PUV terminals the taxi ride is short just beware as we experience the taxi driver got us round out of the way thanks to google map I directed him to take the right route or he will drive us further.  We bought the ticket for around two hundred pesos (sorry forgot the exact amount) but since my parents are both senior citizens they able to have discounted price same with the kids entrance fee. The ticket is already good for the 3 places around the park (The Crocodile Park, Tribu Kamindanawan & Butterfly farm), there are shows on weekends for tribu and crocodile sad to say we go there Thursday so we did not able to see it.  My parents enjoyed the crocodile park since not only crocodiles can be seen but there are also some koi fishes, wild animals like wild boar, tigers & phytons, and farm animals such as ox, ostrich and there are also beautiful species of birds.

ReviewTitle: Great not only to see crocodiles but also for outdoor sports
Review: I went to the park to watch a frisbee game. The place is huge with lots of spaces for outdoor games/sports like soccer, volleyball, and frisbee. The crocodile and butterfly farm is a great plus!

I don't really like seeing caged animals but the entire experience can definitely be recommended for the whole family. Their shows are something to look forward to. Make sure to stay and watch the shows in the afternoon. We were able to watch the Sunday show and it was very entertaining. The staff and animal trainers are also really kind and helpful.

I never like crocodiles so expect this review to be completely subjective.  I only went to the crocodile farm in Davao City as part of the itinerary.  These crocodiles are not pets so they expect to be out in the wild rather than being caged in.  They are unhappy so I'm I by merely looking at them without freedom to roam in the wild.  The fire dance show was inappropriate for the place with reptiles. This can be done elsewhere like they do in Boracay.  For educational purposes alright but the space where all the animals are on exhibit should be wider and spacious. Otherwise, the park owners and managers are not being environment-friendly and should be charged for cruelty to animals!
Its a nice park and we had a lot of fun. There are exhibits for all ages. The fire show was awesome.

Kids who love animals will like the place. Aside from the crocodiles, there are a lot of animals here. It is like a mini zoo. Dont forget to watch the shows. That is what makes this place exciting. However, be prepared to sweat. It is...More

ReviewTitle: Best Zoocrodile Farm in the Philippines
Review: If you are looking for stunt defying, animal engaging, and awesome shows, it is the best place. Although P300 entrance is quite high.
One of the best place to visit in davao city w/your family,want to see a real crocs,visit crocodile farm you may also try their crocs menu

Visited Crocodile Park with family and friends. I noticed that there were many visitors from out of the country. One little boy from Australia asked if the reptiles shown were alligators or crocodiles. The guide of the park didn't know how to answer...lol
we had a quick visit before we wrap up the tour in davao. aside from crocodiles, birds and snakes were presents too. though this place already needs some improvements.
Got a chance to see animals that you just usually see on tv or in some books or you never thought existed 😊

like a small sanctuary with few tigers ostriches snakes and lizards and birds and off course the Crocodiles , there were some entertaining shows with the wildlife and afterwards fire dance show which was entertaining held at dusk

Did not give the feel of a 'park' more like a collection of holding pens for dozy animals. Cheap to enter, there are side shows of snakes and other animals, but very run-down and lacking real investment or business zeal.

The Crocodile Park is very attractive indeed with few beyond imaginable size crocodiles being kept in sanctuary. This park also houses other animals such as snakes, birds and very rare lizards.  Of the most appreciable journey to this park is the availability of the cheap crocodile leathers merchandise. For collectors, this park is definitely a must have itinerary in Davao Del Sur.

So many attractions have been added since i visited last year. The fish and ostrich feeding is quite entertaining, i love the farm village and it's nice that they no longer have an entrance fee when you enter at lolong's (biggest crocodile caught) replica. And oh! the baby ostrich is so adorable :) the fire dance is amazing!

ReviewTitle: Entertaining, but pitifull for the crocs
Review: This place lets you get up close to varying sizes of crocs and appreciate the texture of their armor. It could get a little stinky in the noontime due to the intense sun. I suggest you visit 3pm onwards

Davao Crocodile park is home of Hundreds of Salt Water Crocodile and other different animal species. It has different species of birds, koi, ostrich and snakes. The crocodile park is clean, huge and enjoyable for adults and children. It has morning and afternoon animal shows that informative and fun. What I love the most is orange-the orangutan. He really thinks and act like a human. and before I forget the park has an entrance fee of 160 pesos. They also sell ostrich eggs which I personally see. I was able to take hold of the snake as well and its human friendly. its my first time. and if you want to have free pictures of the creature you can pay 40 pesos for it.   I will recommend the park for families who want to have interactive learning with the animals. They have snack booth so you won't be hungry. Overall, I love the place.

Had a great time here. Very amazed with the crocodiles. There are a lot of animals. The ostrich i met was super friendly! Haha. There was an animal show when we were there. We enjoyed the show! So Cool!
It's a poor park without anything except some crocodiles, eagles, tigers, birds. The park looks very old and boring
Great place to see not just crocodiles but tigers, snakes and birds. The animal show is good for the kids and kids at heart.

This place is a great place to visit in Davao. When we arrived, we thought it was just crocodiles but we were surprised to see emus and even tigers! Add some monkeys and birds and its a great place to go. They have at least 50 crocodiles on site from babies to massive crocs.  Entrance fee is a bit expensive but its worth the visit.

The entrance fee was at P300. To be honest it is expensive and not worth it. It would start off with a show on the antics made by birds, monkeys and chimpanzee.  They should have elevated seats because we could hardly see some of the tricks that these animals did.   Then the host of the show would announce to go to the crocodile. A huge one at that. Then, the tigers. They would show how they feed hem with several whole dressed chicken. Then there was a pool of orange fish (school of fish). You can also feed the ostrich. Feeding cost P20 of course it includes the fish. There was also a breeding place of crocodiles. We saw baby crocs. Saw 1 sheep and several geese. That's it for P300.

I'm always excited even just thinking of visiting this great place as we dont have this kind of park in our place..i was happy to see that they have added some new attractions, like the fishpond.. though we were looking for the "naughty" orangutan..they have also expanded the food area and we have a great time eating durian ice cream...i just hope that they will integrate the dragon fruits here or in some park since they dont have these anymore in the nearby private butterfly park where the dragon fruits abound the last time we visited....
The day I visited here was full of blessings and surprises. From discounted rates to free passes. The place was truly a worth it experience with nature and its dwellers.
Excellent experience. Very educational having loads of other wildlife as well which you can feed certain ones if you wish.

ReviewTitle: The largest live "Salties" I had seen in my life
Review: This park was a bit of a drive from my hotel on Quimbo street, the taxi cab fare totaled P150 at the time of this posting. There was a bit of a language barrier with the cabbie since I didn't speak Visayan but we managed. The entry fee to the park was P250, a bit steep but worth it in my opinion. The crocodiles are truly impressive, but there is much more to see than the salties, you also have an opportunity to feed some big cats (for a fee) and other exotic creatures. Great attraction.

ReviewTitle: not really a fan of animal parks but went just to see the place.
Review: lots of tourists are there, they sell souvenirs and crocodile siomai and crocodile burger. they also have a mini convenience store.  lots of crocs from all sizes. the biggest one is Pangil in it's own enclosure. some animals are inside a small cage.  there's a talent show every fri-sun. witnessed one and it was ok . i just hope they dont hurt the animals.
this is recommendable, its not only crocodiles that you get to see there, but other animals as well. there are also animal shows which kids would enjoy.
Treat out my Dad in Crocodile Park in which he enjoyed watching bird's show, playing with the birds, ostrich, fishes, feeding the crocodile, watching the peacock and the snakes.

ReviewTitle: This is a third world zoo focusing on crocodiles.
Review: I enjoyed the time there, including the weekend 4pm show that centered on kids and education. It was fun. It is third world, but they obviously put effort into making it good. Those expecting the San Diego or Bronx Zoos should stay home. Those wanting fun and allowing it to happen should go. We paid 250P each. My companion, a Filipina, had never before been to a zoo, and watching her enjoyment made it a great day.

Lots of crocs but the water is not so clear and the enclosures are old school and boring. They should keep the water clear so the crocs can be seen. A feeding attraction should be there just like the one in Island Cove crocodile park.

this place has lots of crocodiles, you can expect that. And other zoo stuff.. It's not completely a zoo though.. I hope one day it will be filled with other kinds of animals.. Anyway, this is a fun place especially for those who love crocodiles...

ReviewTitle: Animals got talent & lots of crocodiles!
Review: Best to visit the park on a Friday, Saturday or a Sunday when there's an animal show. Entrance fee is Php 300. We went there on a Saturday so were able to watch the 'Animals got talent' show which starts at 4pm. It may be...More

A tourist place with tourist prices. Yes it´s very beautiful here in this Park, but too much people. I feel this crocodile live under much stress. Because staff do all they can so this crocodile will move. You can buy coffee here from Mount Apo....More
If you're looking for animals then you should really visit croc park! The place is such a wonderful site to have fun as you get to see different kinds of animlas.
I saw Pangil, the biggest crocodile now at the center. We had a great time looking at the baby crocodiles and had pictures taken.
Me and my fiance enjoyed the visit. It was fun. There are many crocodiles and other animals. The show was great. If you are an animal lover- then u should go here!!!

ReviewTitle: Better to meet with a fence in between than to encounter one in the wild!
Review: That's why if you are in the Davao region and have never seen a Crocodile then that's a must visit! If you have seen already several times a Crocodile but have never seen hundreds of baby, toddler, teenager and grown up Crocodiles - it's a...More
The Bird show and the wire man thing is a must-watch. Best part for me is Tribu K'Mindanawan's Fire dance!

There were repairs being made when we went and the facility itself is really worn out. If you wanna see crocs, there's lots of it and you won't be disappointed. Except.... the cages and corrals for them are already overcrowded and the build isn't really...More

its very good , loads of crocs , fun for kids , there are also birds and big boa snakes if you like them , take plenty of water as i found it very humid in the park , but overall very good and intresting

ReviewTitle: Re-live your love for animals. Very nice park for kids, adults, and anyone! :)
Review: Crocodile Park is one of the attractions in Davao City. If you love animals, or just want to see them, it is a place to be. You could see birds, eagles, snakes, iguanas, lion, tigers, ostriches, goats, sheep, ducks, etc. During weekends, I guess, they...More

It is the 3rd time to visit in 6 years. The park improved every year. Our 2 boys (9&11) enjoyed the animals. Feeding the ostrich and the fishes. Watching the young Leon and monkey. Going into the cage with big lizard and turtle. Watching the...More
We had fun watching the animal show as well as the fire dance performed by Tribu K' Mindanawan dance Troupe.

ReviewTitle: only decent park to visit in davao
Review: I like the scenic surrounding.. beautiful landscape..but once you enter the park it was horrible ..the place was not well kept ..most of the animals look aged and unhealthy..I know the management is having financial constraints..the teeth of the crocodile are so expensive ..other than...More
The facility is well kept and maintained. The animals were takes cared. The staff were courteous and knowledgeable.
Fun place for family. They have quite the crocodile raising program. Go early to beat the heat though.

ReviewTitle: Recommended for kids and kids at heart
Review: We were able to catch the animal show at 4pm. The show was worth it and compensated for the time that we weren't able to tour the farm because of the rainy weather. Kids will enjoy it.

The place was great... growing up in Davao, i cannot believe i did not visit sooner. My daughter enjoyed the activities (koi and ostrich feeding ). She grew up in a very urban setting so it was a real treat to interact with the animals.
i love staying on this park, the crocs are supper lazy but i enjoy staying here due to other animals in the zoo. i love playing with ostrich, turtle, lizard and the fishes on the pond.

I was hesitant at first, I am never a zoo lover. I never was interested to see live animals. BUT thank you to my husband who reminded me to be interested as a good example to our son. In the end, I was happy, I...More

As a world wide traveller, I have seen many similar places like this. This one is really friendly and attractive, even is mostly for kids. Probably a guide will make things better. Otherwise, is well presented and clean. The crocodile food area in the neighbourhood...More
It is quite interesting, but the restaurant there the riverside grill , very bad service, waiters are sarcastic & arrogant.

We went here last March with my kids, hubby and a friend. It is a big place with lots of different animals and crocodiles. We enjoyed the place and so the kids. Their favorite part is when they hand fed the fishes. It reminded me...More

It is a mixture of thrill, fun and excitement. The park showcases crocodiles, snakes, birds, monkeys, ostrich, fish, tiger, peacocks, rabbits and other animals. I am saddened by one of the shows wherein one of the park attendants walked the wire with 80 crocodiles underneath....More

I took my family for a day out at this park and we really enjoed. there are so many crocs to see and my dad almost touched a big croc before it snapped its mouth closed. I even found a resturant selling crocodile meat outside
This is another boring attraction to see a crocodile sleep, the short stage show is for kids, don't last long and then you can walk around the jungle if interested,
This is a very nice place to visit, there are loads of animals to see and the animal show is good for children of all ages. A very nice place to take the kids.
Nice place for family bonding... Nice to have fun with friends too... Love the place even if the employees is not smiling...

This is by far the most clean, organized, and safe Zoo I've been in within the Philippines. The animals look healthy and they are being taken cared of properly. The entire park is very spacious and clean. All the staff is very nice and helpful....More

ReviewTitle: If you love animals don't come here
Review: I am ashamed to say I actually paid money to enter a place that set up such appalling conditions for the beautiful animals that reside there. Simply put there is just not enough space, animals are crammed into spaces that are WAY TOO SMALL. Most...More
It's my first time to went there, first i'm afraid of crocodile but if you visit there some other time. it was a great little Zoo adventure
It's improved than my last time visit the park become more cleaner and organized and have some activities and programs to entertain
See different species of birds, fowls, monkeys, snakes and all other kinds of animals inside and of course the crocodiles....don't forget to try the famous civet coffee near the entrance.
Crocodile Park is a must do. Great value for money and fun things to do inside. Make sure you get some food to hand feed the fish :)

Very barbaric compared to the zoos and wildlife parks I have been to in New Zealand (I haven't been to any, in any other countries) The Tigers were in very small cages, which were hardly the length of the Tigers themselves. A lone lion cub...More
It's the second time I visit Crocodile's Park. Always the same feeling: marvelous trip, interesting visit, emotions, in a clean place and welcoming people.

Quite exciting to see them protected...great job by making the place more interesting with other animals and attractions. it gets quite hot though, but still worth a visit. Very educational and staff are always helpful.
My son didn't seem to really like it it's more interested with the heat and getting some place cool. I don't know how I felt about it crocodiles as just crocodile
Some of the animals, especially the Tigers, appeared to be underfed and kept in very cramped cages. I really felt extremely bad for them.

You can go here and see plenty of tigers (5 when I was there, all of which I felt sorry for because of their limited space in tiny cages), alligators of course (including dead ones being roasted over coals whose meat is sold for 70pp...More

It's a small zoo with lots of different animals. Children will definitely enjoy it. We just bought tickets for P250 per head on a weekday just to kill time. The ticket includes the entrance to the nearby Tribu K'Mindanawan and Butterfly park. The trip would...More
It was quite entertaining. We saw a different kind of animals tricks. The best was was the K tribu something with their fire dancing.
What an experience to see such a huge crocodile and the beautiful tigers! There is a show with various birds and animals taking part which must be seen to be appreciated.
Crocodile is normal park, it may kids enjoy for spend some times in there. You can also feed the crocodiles with small amount of fee.

ReviewTitle: For the love of crocs and other animals
Review: It was my second time to visit the crocodile park and im happy that there are added attractions there. you can buy souvenirs, dine at resto. watch a very amazing fire dance during friday saturday and sunday. have a tattoo. What I really loved during...More

Entrance fee of 250 for adult and 150 for kids is very acceptable. This amount gives you entrance for crocodile park, butterfly house and Tribu Kamindanawan. Crocodile park has a show that starts at 4pm. I dont know if this is done everyday or weekends only. I suggest you get your tickets if you arrive around 1pm then go straight to the Butterfly house which is located quite a distance from the park. We arrived around 2:30pm so our time concentrated mostly at crocodile park.  There are a lot of animals to see and things to do like fish, ostrich and tiger feeding. The show which started at 4 was also fun. the show ended around 5pm which gave you time to look at the shops on your way to TrIbu Kamindanawan. You will be entertained at the venue with firedancing. Overall we had a great time at crocodile park. The kids really enjoyed the interaction. A word of advice, bsring extra shirt as you'll never know you might get wet when they introduce to you "Pangil" - a very large croc.

ReviewTitle: IF Crocs are your thing, they're here
Review: Philippine Crocodile park is a small zoo built around the hundreds of crocodiles in the park of all shapes and sizes. They also have a large collection of Pythons native to the Philippines and a few non-native critters as well (like the ostriches)

I recommend going on weekdays since there won't be a lot of people on that time, they have a large amount of crocodiles and they also have different kinds of animals suck as monkeys, snakes, birds, tiger and etc. They also have stores that u can buy food at. I recommend trying they're ice cream near the store.

here we found the wild animals like crocodiles, butterflies and birds. there are also many species and variety of one of a kind and rare animals. when you are here try the exotic crocodile dish and ostrich ice cream. the civet coffee and many more

ReviewTitle: A One of A Kind Park & Mini Zoo
Review: Crocodile Park in Davao City strategically located at Dizon Propery in Diversion Road is a park and mini zoo at the same time. The main attraction is the host of crocodiles being breed in the place by its owners for varied purposes. The crocodiles are provided with concrete habitats adapted to their natural living conditions. Their livings quarters are designed in such a way that they can be viewed by interested tourists at the same time they are comfortable. The main attraction of the park is the Crocodile show where a trained man walks in a tightrope above the crocodile quarters, crossing to the other side with the hungry crocodiles underneath him.... Scary and breath taking!!!
plenty of crocs with little to no movement. i did not try the icecream that i heard about after i went a must do from people that have had it
I enjoyed my trip here. I like what I saw in this park. I even held snake and baby croc. The price to get in was very reasonable. I'll recommend this park for weekend family activities.

ReviewTitle: Wide variety of animals with entertaining shows!
Review: I went here with my family along with some my siblings, nieces and nephews. We went to look at the different animals and I love how the park has a lot of animals in there.   You can feed the lion, the crocodile and some birds. You also can get up close with the ostriches as well as get near the monkeys. The shows are also entertaining.   There is a comfort room always nearby and they sell great food too! I recommend this place if you want a great family time.
We do annual grade level field trip in this place for our students' performance task. They offer discounts for big groups, and very accommodating to our needs ;)

ReviewTitle: I disgusting prison for beautful wildlife. It is poorly managed and the ethos sickens me.
Review: While I was there I may have looked like a happy tourist but I can assure you I was far from it. I saw wounded crocodiles (though their size impressed me) as they are in a space too small for them all and were clearly fighting. Birds in chains, rainforest animals in enclosures with no stimulation, metal bars and concrete floors, overcrowded tiger enclosure (when a tiger is a naturally solitary creature), no privacy for the animals, and the worst for me watching an orangutan collapsing all over her cage on the hard concrete, still on display, coming around from drugs administered. They allow you to hold the reptiles but don't encourage you to disinfect your hands after. They should have a gel. This could potentially lead to salmonella if not careful. I am not sure of the risk, but still a disinfectant should be used. They also had a lot of crocodile leather etc for sale. Yet they call themselves conservationists???!!! This place was originally a crocodile farm, but obviously adding more animals (which they continue to buy) made an attraction. The fish pond is overstocked with koi carp and the water is filthy. The parrots look miserable and are in chains with no privacy.  So yes basically please don't go here and add your voice to enforce positive change on this hell hole or to close it down!

The place is accessible by taxis.  There are so much crocodiles in all sizes. There are other animals found like different birds, ostrich, snakes, tigers, koi, and monkeys. What's nice is they allow interaction between animals. We fed the kois and ostriches. Feeding the ostrich was quite an experience, seeing a huge animal approaching you and feeding on your hand is little frightening at the beginning.  There is an animal show. Too bad the seats are not enough to accommodate everyone. But it was enjoyable and educational.  There is an ice cream store outside the park. We tried a crocodile ice cream and it has crocodile egg; it has similar taste with regular ice cream.  The fire show is also okay.   I recommend this place especially for families and kids.

ReviewTitle: good for kids to visit this place
Review: its more fun to come in this crocodile farm coz you can get closer with selected friendly animals and take photo.... getting to know different kind of breeds animals, not only crocodile also birds and snake. they have also animal show start to 4pm until 6pm.... you must try....
We really enjoyed this place. They have much more than just crocs. We stayed for the fire show witch was great. I'd go here again!

Certainly a place to visit if you want to escape the hassle and noise of the city. More like a small zoo than just a crocodile farm. The crocs are the main attraction though.  There are however a few other exotic animals. There is even an animal I have never seen before and I have been to a lot zoos. Half monkey - half bear! What a sight. A reason enough to go there.

ReviewTitle: First time at this place, Davao Crocodile Park!
Review: We decided to bring our nephew to this sanctuary one Sunday morning. When we arrived at the place, I was surprised by the cleanliness and the proper layout of the entire facility. Each crocodile cage were properly labeled and arranged. Arranged according to the size of the crocodiles (i.e. the biggest crocodile was placed near the entrance, etc). Another thing, the natural smell of the animals (crocodiles, tigers, etc.) were not so overpowering, meaning to say, the cages are being maintained and cleaned regularly. Special mentioned is their koi pond, my nephew had a blast feeding these adorable fishes.  But all is not perfect, obviously, they need to make bigger cages for the tigers so that they can freely roam. You know, small cages are stressful for the tigers. Improve their canteen and souvenir shop.  Overall, this is a good place to bring the kids and the whole family for relaxing and learning.

ReviewTitle: The giant crocodile was the best attraction
Review: These were crocodiles you only watch on NatGeo or the news. They were there snapping at each other and the sound was mind-numbing. We got there a good ten minutes before closing. The ticket people still charged us full rate without telling us they were closing shortly. We had to hurry our way around the compound to maximise our time.

we visit this park every couple of years and each time we go it improves. this year it was superb, they have added a few more attractions which makes the visit even more pleasurable. you can now hand feed the fish or see the exciting bird and animal show. for a small private owned rescue centre, this place just keeps getting better. a great half day out and at a reasonable price.

Went there last January 4 of this year together with my boyfriend since he wanted to see a crocodile, I've been there for a total of three times with a great time distances, one from which I was just 4 years old, second time was when I was 14 during our Science Field Trip and this year. I did the same thing from 7 years ago, I held the python and the crocodile, though 7 years ago there were no tigers it was my first time seeing them that close. It was fun but I was a little skeptical about how strong the cages are. It was a cool experience to be seeing those animals. But at the same time I feel sad with those that are in the cages (not the crocs and the snakes) Entrance fee cost 250 per head. And their ice cream was so yummy.

ReviewTitle: An Excellent Way to Kill a Few Hours with the Family
Review: Kind of a mini-zoo with various opportunities to feed the animals. Great for young kids. It was kind of wild to see a croc being roasted on a spit at the end. But hey, it's exotic. 800 php for 2 parents and 2 kids.

The place defines what a crocodile park should be, however, there are alot of visitors and it is a bit hard to photograph without accidentally taking a picture of another person. There are other animals too and at the end of the park there is...More

ReviewTitle: A great way to entertain visitors
Review: I have been to the park 4 times now and always enjoyed myself. We have taken our overseas guests and they have all been truly amazed. Make sure you don't miss the feeding time at 3pm especially the feeding of the tiger.
Great place to learn and be inspired in conserving nature. Visiting the place also helps in conserving the animals in there. Kids do enjoy it! I'll give it two thumbs up👍🏼👍🏼
Nice place to visit, but hard to get a taxi after dark. Shows were fun to see, and a great place to take kids.

Crock park's are the same all over the world. But this one has a good show. And you shoumd go on feeding day. But the vest is sved for afterdark. You go to the resturant and have great pinoy meal and ig you like you...More

There are plenty of animals to look at here. But the cages were way too small. It was obvious that some of the animals was stressed with their small confinement. Photo opp with snakes and crocodile was cool though
Took a quick visit. Very clean nice park. Good shows. Had a good time. Didn't get to spend enough time here. Can't wait to go again. Beautiful place.

Crocs are not just the main attraction here. Land, air and water animals are present, too. We came on a weekday so there weren't many people/visitors around. Most of the animals were either asleep or resting so we didn't really get to "mingle" with them...More

If you like crocodiles then this park is for you! I found it a little boring and repetitive and the smell. Good for younger kids. Had a few different things like ostriches, tigers, birds, tortoises, orangutans.

Crocodile park in davao is your gate to try the wild water adventure or wild water rafting. I will review the davao wild water adventure first. There are strong and weak points during our adventure let us start with the strong ones: 1. Locker are...More

It's my nephew first trip to Davao city, so we decided to bring him to the crocodile park, it was indeed an Amazing visit as the place is well maintained. Even me, I'm surprised to see some animals in the place as im expecting to...More

ReviewTitle: Lots of crocodiles and many other animals
Review: We spent an afternoon here and really enjoyed the place.Of course crocodiles were here but also eagles,monkeys,ostriches,parrots,pythons,turtles,and many others.The admission is very cheap and includes a 1 hour show with eagles,parrots,orangatangs,monkeys,etc.It was quite entertaining.Children will love this place.A wonderful example of nature and animals being...More

Simple one of the best tourist attraction on Davao City! Educational and very organized, Crocodile Park gives their customers the satisfaction that they worthily paid for! Don't miss the shows, from a monkey playing basketball to a tiger climbing a pole for its meal! Yes...More

ReviewTitle: What a Great place to take the family when in Davao
Review: A fantastic place to spend a day or Afternoon with the family. This place has a large collection of crocodiles ranging from Hatchlings all the way up to a 15 foot monster. There are tiggers and numerous native birds to see. It is not just...More

Aside from seeing the juvenile to the adult crocodiles, there were also some other animals to see like birds, snakes, bearcats, monkeys, ostriches, turtles and a few more. It has an interactive arena where guests can hold and take pictures with a big snake, a...More

I thought the place is just like the same crocodile park I have seen in other places before but it thrills me to see crocodiles and the lion feasting on the meat being given by the caretaker. The animal show is amazing and the buwis...More

ReviewTitle: Well kept Zoo & Great animal show
Review: You should time your visit on Fridays to Sunday around 4pm. They have a great animal show. We got our tickets for Php 200 for adults, inclusive on entrance to the Zoo, butterfly park and Tribu K (fire dance show); all of which are walking...More

ReviewTitle: A showcase of different kinds of animals!
Review: I thought, I will only be able to see many crocodiles here but when we got there, I was wrong. They have lots of animals from different kinds of birds to snakes as well as huge lions.  The entrance fee is 200php but if you wanted to get closer to the cage of the lions you'll add 25php. There are also restaurants and booths inside and near the place when you can have your meal or snack e.g. ice cream, sugar cane juice.  I can say that It's not pretty amazing but worth the visit.

ReviewTitle: I Guess Crocs Don't Need Much to Live On...
Review: ...but the rest of the animals and birds in this park do!  PROS - If you're a city kid/adult, there's probably not a lot of places like this you can go to see a wide range of animals. I mean they have tigers, an orangutang, ostriches, pythons, and loads of crocodiles. The feeding time show is something you really don't see everyday.  CONS - It's really not that well-maintained. The tigers pace in their cramped cages. There's wear and tear everywhere. It would be lovely if the greenery were more lush and healthier. Only the crocs don't care that their water is dirty.  More people should go so they can have more funds to better the upkeep of the park.
Missed the crocodile show. The Phyton was scary although tamed and the mouth closed. There were a lot of out of owners which is good for the tourism.

We arrived in the Park at 8:30 AM on a Sunday, which was just 30 minutes from the time that they opened. As expected, the park is jam packed with students who were on their excursion. The last time that I visited the park was way back in the 90's ( i know. i haven't got enough time to roam around :D ) my 3 year old son enjoyed the show and he got so fascinated with all the crocodiles that he saw ( he just got disappointed when he didn't see any cheetahs . LOL! ). The park opens at 8 AM. Adult entrance fee is 200 pesos and child entrance fee is 100 pesos. There is also a souvenir shop just on the right side when you are about to exit the park. They have strollers for rent for children which could range from 60pesos-100pesos (if i am not mistaken) just right at the entrance.  We just did not stay that long on the crocs area coz of the stinky smell, so as on the area where the monkeys are. We could not stand it. The ice cream that they are selling just right outside, near the exit area is superb. it tastes good that you have to try it, it is 60 pesos for 2 scoops of the ice cream. Part of the tour is the butterfly sanctuary(i think that is what it is called). You have to walk a distance though to get there, or it would be better if you bring with you your car for it to be much more easier for you to get there.. there were just a number of butterflies,not like before. There's a little bit of a playground for the kids, trees, benches and tables where you can sit down and rest for a while.  If you want your kids to enjoy and learn, this is a must visit place.

It was awesome the first time we visited like 3-4 years ago, and again this year. I'm amazed how big this crocodile named Pangil, I believe he was the biggest croc in captivity since Lolong was captured. Better to visit this zoo during weekends because they have a show at 3pm. For me the most entertaining part of the show is how they poke a stick to Pangil to agitate him and you can see him up close and feel his powerful jaw clamp its way to the stick. Amazing! I do hope they know what they're doing, I'm kinda worried because they might stress this wonderful creature.
Making ur kids experience how does crocodile and other animals looks in real life..my kids really love it here.. It was a very nice experience and for sure we will visit again next time..
Oh my if you have knack for exotic food, this is the place... this is the place for recreation if you have children, your friends, family.

my idea of a park is where you can take a picnic anywhere within the vicinity. sadly, this place is not conducive for that. with a 200 peso entance fee, it's quite exorbitant for a regular local tourist. the place is quite cramped for its growing animal population(or the space is just maximized).but if you're an animal lover, the tigers and the crocs are enough to make your experience fun.

We had a lot of fun here by watching different kind of shows. And that guy walking on a thin wire amazed everyone by his "buwis buhay" performance! lol . We tried the crocodile ice cream and i think there's nothing special with that ice cream. lol

While visiting Davao, my wife and I looked up places to visit and decided on Crocodile Park which seemed to have good reviews. We were both disappointed in the place. There was only one show on schedule and we missed the first half of that. It felt like there were more birds and other animals in cages then actual crocodiles. The entry fee boasted of free trip to Butterfuly farm also and a fire show. However, the Butterfly farm consisted of one pen with one species of butterfies and we were told the fire show was only on weekends. It only took about 45 minutes to view the place and we both left feeling a little jilted. It's ok to visit once especially if you have children, but go on a weekend or you will be wasting your time.
If you like seeing animals suffer in confined spaces then this is the place for you. Don't ride you bike to this park as they do not allow bicycles anywhere on the property, not even in the car park.

this was a fairly uninspiring experience. there were a lot of crocodiles, keep in rather run down conditions. there were serveral other animals as well keep in smallish cages. there was li ited opportunity to interact. the crocodiles farms in malaysia are far more interesting
The park is well kept but nothing much to show and the souvenirs on sale are pricy. I had fun with the ostrich though.
Not everyone know's that an ice cream made of crocodile exist. I'm not sure if it really is made of crocodile but it tasted like one. (I tried crocodile sisig and it's really good).
Maybe not more than but nearly 10times With family members, relatives and friends from other countries and cities. Atleast once, check this place. Good for tourist

ReviewTitle: One of the best zoos in the country.
Review: The Davao Crocodile Park is a huge complex where souvenir shops, restaurants and tours are offered (such as the Davao Wildwater Adventure). There is a good amount of different animals inside and you can even take of pictures with them for a minimal fee of Php 40 (US$ 0.86). Those animals include a yellow boa constrictor, parrots, Brahiny kite, iguana and, though I haven't seen myself, a baby croc. Here's my other observations:  The upside:  1. Well-maintained and clean unlike the Crocodile Farm in Puerto Princessa, Palawan. 2. Plenty of animals.  3. Easily accessible from the city center. Don't be fooled by the distance. Take a jeep from downtown to St. Peter's Parish in Maa (pls confirm this to the locals, I tend to forget things a lot) then a motorcycle to the complex. Total ride wouldn't take more than 30 minutes.  4. A few food center are inside but souvenir shops are few and don't offer a lot.  5. Animal show is very entertaining and hosted by a great animal enthusiast.  6. Countryside and adventure tours are offered inside which may save you time.   The downside:  1. Entrance fee of Php 200 (US$ 4.28) is a bit more than other zoos in the country but still worth it.  2. As far as I am aware of, the animal show (called the Animals Got Talent) is only shown around 4pm and none in the morning.  3. Restrooms, though smells disinfected a lot, already seen its prime days.  The Davao Crocodile Park is definitely a must-see for tourists and locals alike. It was well-maintained unlike some of the parks that I have seen myself and was never boring. It is an added plus that I got a complimentary pass after I signed up for the Davao Wildwater Adventure and the Tribu K' Mindanawan and its Kaonanan restaurant.

You get a chance to see these guys pretty close up. Safety of fences of course. Cost was minimal and is a nice place to stroll around. Other attractions are close by. So you can do three different ones together.
Nice palce for locals and tourists to go to. Very informative ... And they sell the civet coffee at their spivenier shop too.

ReviewTitle: Must place to visit for Photographers!
Review: Yes, this place is really interesting since it gives you a close feel to nature and animals you don't often see in Manila. An escape from the usual sight of buildings and crowded busy streets. We had fun taking pictures of the crocs and their usual reactions! ;)

this is my second time to visit the place ... not maintained , not cost effective for an entrance fee of 200 --- no tourist guide to assist you , staffs not accomodating ,water full of molds and algaes , foul and. pungent smell, i think as one of the tourist spot in davao they should maintain the good atmosphere and cleanliness in the area

ReviewTitle: an excellent combination of entertainment shows
Review: you should visit this place afternoon. the reason is... when you purchase your ticket you'll receive 3 tickets together. one for crocodile park,one for butterfly house(200-300m away from croc park), & one for the unique fire dance show. you can get a photo with a giant python & crocodile. you can see a man do stunt works on a rope over a crocodile cage. i would not recommend the show with tigers as the tigers were caged in a manner not so much secured. i mean the cages. butterfly house...hmmmm i'd say 5/10 you should definitely watch the fire dance. 100% unique. 10/10 to experience the best you should go there afternoon. otherwise you'll feel its worthless.

ReviewTitle: Must Visit!!! 1 Day City Tour Itinerary
