This place is good enough for those pèrsin who didnt go yet in palawan... nice place thou.. but please put some more animals inside ehhheheh
I find the entrance a little bit costly. But if you like crocs, this is the place to go. I have heard they supply LV for croc leathers. Also, they serve croc pizza!

Typical zoo. It was our first time to try crocodile egg ice cream. They have crocodile and ostrich egg. You can see LOTS of crocodile including Pangil, the biggest one. We were lucky there was an animal show when we visited the place.

User: General Santos City, General Santos, Philippines
Location: General Santos City, General Santos, Philippines
Review: the first time i went here i was with my daughter. we enjoyed a lot since its our first time to hold exotic animals. good for family picnics.

The white water rafting operator is located in Crocodile Park! After the white water adventure, I was able to walk around. The park is nicely laid out. They have some MASSIVE crocodiles in this park which is nice to see. Well secured for customer safety.

ReviewTitle: Not bad but still could be better
Review: Staff were friendly the bird show was great....animals did not look too happy though an older style animal park that probably needs to update its facilities more so for the animals

The sight of a group of crocs resting in an enclosed area is already fascinating. Just what you would expect from a croc farm. But yeah, I just hope there were some crew who would talk to us from time to time rather than settle...More
It was ok. typical crocodile farm. Palawan is better. I wish they have a tour guide to educate smaller groups. I believe they have guide for bigger groups.
Its just a normal crocodile farm and it also houses some tigers, apes, snakes and birds. It was raining at that time so we didn't really spend much time there.

ReviewTitle: A day with zoo animals, a day with nature!
Review: We have visisted the place as part of our Nature Tour package in Davao. Since the place is called Crocodile park, we are expecting that mostly its about crocodiles but then we were surprised that it was like a mini-zoo. Although during our time of...More

The crocodiles and the other animals looked sad, the place is depressing. I hope the owners will provide more maintainance for this park. It has so much potentials to be a good park, but sad to say it looks old and poorly maintained

We went there as a adult couple. The park itself is not so big. It's especially nice for kids. They have cool animals though, not only crocodiles, but also lizards and turtles you can see in a free walking zone. There are also ostriches and...More

ReviewTitle: LOTS OF FUN FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY
Review: A bit of a trip from the city the crocodile park is great fun for the family, especially the kids. They have shows with birds, tigers and don't forget the many crocodiles. It can get hot and sunny during the day so don't forget the...More
Great place to see crocodiles of different age and size! go around 3:00pm to see them feed the animals. Great place to visit if you are into local wildlife..

They have constantly continued to upgrade this place every year. This was the 3rd time if visited in 6 years and it gets better every year. Don't expect the place to be on a par with some of the major zoos, this is a nice...More

We enjoyed this place so much especially the show! The crocodile frenzy was scary. The dancing crocodiles was awesome. and the tightrope walking was a nerve-wracking eperience! There are also other attarctions nearby, like the Butterfly Garden, a walk away from the park and the...More

ReviewTitle: Try the civet coffee and croc ice cream!
Review: The animals look healthy and the place is well maintained. This is also where you can try a cup of the rare civet coffee for only 150php.

I am from New Zealand and I took my Filipina GF and her daughter to The Crocodile Park in the hope of having a nice and interesting 1/2 day out. I have to be honest and felt the experience was a big let down and...More

We took the extended family here for a visit. While we were disappointed with the crocodile aspect of the farm, we enjoyed getting up very close with the tigers, bats and birds. We also went into the "dragon" area where we had a closer encounter...More

We were here for just a short while with the kids just after lunch. They have affordable entrance fee. They also have shows which we did not avail since it will still be late in the afternoon. We took photos with the albino python, enjoyed...More

The park is well-maintained. The comfort rooms are not spotless but fortunately, it doesn't stink. There are plenty of things to see in the park and you don't need a lot of time to explore it. There are also other animals like birds and other...More

ReviewTitle: Have a Crocodile Egg's Ice Cream
Review: I interested with this place because have a crocodile's egg ice cream taste durian. A lot of animals in here (not only crocodile) . have also bird, turtle, snake etc. have a food court inside. Crocodile park is near Davao Zorb Park, Butterfly Garden. You...More

Remember that this is the Philippines and not America, so they don't have the funds to build a nice, fancy zoo. That said, they have done what they could with the resources they have. Unfortunately, it was sad to see how many of the animals were kept. For young children wanting to learn about snakes & crocodiles it can be educational. And they have a few exotic birds. But overall, it was depressing to see and I'm sure the animals are not very happy.

ReviewTitle: Live Crocodiles at Davao Crocodile Farm
Review: The short visit to the crocodile farm was amusing. There was an hour show about birds first before we are allowed to see the crocodile in there created habitat. There were many small, big, and large crocodile around. Some are active while others are just sleeping. Dressed chicken was the food given to them by the caretakers.  We saw Live Ostrich also in the other side of the farm. I saw an Ostrich laid egg, so big that it can fill a large bowl. It's an amazing animal. Considered a bird but so tall that it cannot fly.  by the night, a Tribu K' Mindanawan Dance Troup had a Fire Dance Show... Beautiful and what an experience.

Brought the kids here for a day out and spent about 8 hours here! Lots to see and do. The kids were in Gatorland in Florida and this place in Davao is comparable and not expensive.  Overall, a great place for a family with lots to see and do.

ReviewTitle: Great place to take the children.
Review: We liked the afternoon shows - the birds, the monkeys, etc. The feeding of the crocodiles and tigers of course are the highlights.

ReviewTitle: Only for those with a crocodile fetish
Review: If you don't have much time in Davao, I'd give this park a miss unless you have a crocodile obsession or want to see how your expensive leather handbag looked when it was still alive. It's a small park that isn't well maintained. The crocodile habitat seemed fine. But the condition of the cages for most of the other animals seem too small or too neglected. I also felt sad seeing birds chained to a perch.  I went on a Wednesday afternoon and there weren't much people there. That means, getting out can involve a long wait for a taxi. I had to wait about 30 minutes. There aren't even guys on motobikes for hire.  It seems this area will eventually develop into some sort of tourism complex where many attractions can be found in one place. In addition to the crocodile park, there’s an area for a boating adventure and a butterfly park. There's plenty of empty acres for more attractions. So once this area gets more built-up with other things to do, it may be worth a visit to come out to this park.  The most interesting part of my visit did not involve the park. It was when I left the park on taxi and drove south on the main highway through Ma-a. The area felt provincial and yet, the standard of living seem much higher compared to rest of provincial Philippines. There were nice schools, churches and businesses lining the highway. It made me want to stop and take some photos.
since i love animals, i have no issues at all. you better see it for yourself, appreciation is something to consider

Well-kept grounds. You can see crocs in diff stages (small ones from the time they are hatched and full-grown ones). We tried the croc burger, per my husband's prodding. So you might as well try too in case you decide to drop by.
Great mix of attractions from our young child, to us and to mama also. Fun interactive shows, and a good variety of animals and reptiles. Well priced happy family fun
The place was ok but i think the animals can use more care. The cages looked like it needs maintenance The souvenir shop though is great. Loved the coffee they sell there.

It was my first time to go Davao, and by exploring the place It makes me really amazed by how the city keep its nature wild life last. It was great to visit the place and though I experience eating the first time ever crocodile strawberry ice-cream. It taste good as well :)

ReviewTitle: You can fed the crocs by yourself
Review: It was a nice experience to have a fed a crocodile. A nice place to relax and it is clean, too. The staff are friendly.

About the olny down side to this place is much of the cages are just to small for the animals. Other than that it is a very nice place to visit. It is clean (by Philippine standards) and you get to feed a few of the animals and even hold a giant boa constrictor. They have a small but nice gift shop and when I was there you could also get something to eat and drink.
The crocodiles are not able to be free to roam, locked up with 100s in a small cage. The orangutan cage made me cry, did not take any photos

The place was just like the typical zoos in Manila or Crocodile Park in Palawan, but what most tourists are attracted was the shows conducted by their so-called "Ambassadors of Nature" Me and my friends enjoy the show given by these ambassadors of the nature. We're like kids who are clapping and really laugh with the acts that these animals made.

we visited here May 2014.   against my will, i gave it a try to visit the place to kill time. I am against animal captivity but my friend was insisting so we dropped by.   before we could even park the car, i couldn't believe what i saw. they are roasting crocodiles and serve it to guests who want to try it. it blew my mind! and by the way, they also have crocodile flavored ice cream and they sell crocodile meat too.   they keep the surroundings clean but i really pity animals in captivity. those birds that are kept in chains, i can almost hear them say "what should i do with these wings?"   There's a huge crocodile in the pool. alone, maybe dying of boredom too!   well if you want to give it a try, entrance is at Php200 when we were there. just a small park actually.

Taxi driver assured us it was still open (7:30p.m.) When we arrived it was closed, had to return back to resort (waste of money), they close at 5p.m...Dont believe taxi cab drivers- not all are honest.

Entrance fee is 200 pesos per person and you get to see 3 attractions: Crocodile Park, Tribu Kamindanawan and Butterfly House. The Park was quite fun for the kids since they got to see other animals aside from crocodiles. There were ostriches, birds, peacocks, snakes, eagles, monkeys etc. They even got to touch the birds & snakes and feed the crocodiles. The place is quite hot when we got there at around 10:30am. Nothing much to see though at the other 2 attractions. We skipped going to the Butterfly House since it was far and small anyway.

The crocodile park is actually an animal park. Aside from the crocodiles, other animals are on display on cages such as birds, ostrich,,snakes and monkeys. There are also stuffed animals on display. The crocodiles are still the stars of the park. There are young and adult crocodiles, small and big crocodiles. There are burger kiosk and souvenir store at the entrance. bringing an umbrella is a must for the visit as protection for the sun or the rain. There are no trees or shady areas in between cages. The park staff are friendly and helpful. Souvenir items are also affordable. This is an recommended for educational trip and for those who love nature.

ReviewTitle: Park is OK; Butterfly House is a waste of time
Review: We got here on a really hot Sunday afternoon just before 3 o'clock because info from blogs and websites say the first show starts at 3:15 pm and we were hoping not to miss any. But it was 3:30 pm and still no show has started, and we already toured the whole place, had a picture with the yellow snake and the little croc. Thirsty and hungry, we went back to the area near the entrance because there was a burger kiosk there selling croc meat and ostrich meat burger. But they conveniently ran out of croc meat and no bun so no ostrich burger, either. So we ventured in towards area with pasalubong stores but failed to obtain crocodile ice cream and civet coffee (no stock).   It was nearing 4pm and still no show, so we decided to go to the Butterfly House. The staff we asked for directions told us it was "walking distance lang, mam." He must have been with Moses during the Exodus, because the distance from the main park to the Butterfly House was walking distance of biblical proportions. And when we got there, well, let me say that the Butterfly House itself was smaller than my mother's shoe closet and we finished 'touring' the place in under 3 minutes.  When we got back to the main park, the show has already started with some cockatoo playing basketball. We didn't stick around for the other shows because we were already tired, hot, thirsty and hungry. We will just watch the shows on Youtube. We'd probably go back there the next time we visit Davao, but maybe after 5 pm and on December when the weather is significantly less hot and humid.  Tips for people who want to visit the park: Bring water, don't lose your other tickets (you will be given 3 stubs - one for the main park, one for the tribu k'mindanawan, and the other for the Butterfly House), and go there after 4 PM. Transpo is not a problem as there are a lot of cabs hanging about, and the staff will call for more cabs for visitors who haven't got private transpo. But there is no transpo going to the Butterfly House (croc-drawn carts, anyone?) so you'll def have to walk.  All in all our visit was a bust mainly because of non-animal related issues. They had lots of other animals (mostly reptiles and birds and 2 tigers) not just crocodiles. Other than the animals, you can go to the Riverside grill/cafe where they serve crocodile- and ostrich-based and normal-animal food (like sisig, steak, etc.). Entrance fee of Php 200 seemed expensive. And don't go to the Butterfly House - avoid it like the plague.
Wow, the crocodiles in Davao are bigger than those in Palawan.....and we were there just in time for their feeding and it was really an experience to see them in action to get their food.....

I've been joking about changing the name to "animal park" instead of a crocodile alone :) You can see a lot of other animals like snakes, monkey, etc. It's also educational esp. for kids but I don't like to come back and spend another Php 200 for that...quite expensive.It's actually a package of 3 when you pay that amount, together with Butterfly sanctuary & "Kamindanawan"... ooopps forgot the name :) I just hope they'll separate the fee for each & not force to pay even if u don't feel like going to the other. It will now be affordable to everyone esp. if you'll be paying for the others also :).  It's actually my second time, but the first was a free tour after our seminar. I don't feel like going inside anymore but have to accompany my family. I feel bored already, if only not for my lovedones.
The park is good but it is sad to see other animals locked up in a cage. It's good to see plenty of crocodiles. They have plenty of attractions inside like feeding the ostrich etc...
Not worth the travel and entrance fees. So as not to waste our time and entrance fees, we opted to have fun taking pictures instead.
It is a nice small nature park. The birds are great to look at and I like the reptiles. And yes we tried the crocodile it was nice and know it does not taste like chicken.

this is a learning experience and its nice to know that we have places like this that makes sure the species are protected and that they advocate on the care for nature. Kudos, to the team of the crocodile park
Great for family outing. Plus they've got a tiger and butterfly sanctuary. for those who are fond of exotic food, they have crocodile lechon and grilled meat.

Park is clean and well maintained. Besides crocodiles, there are other animals in the park such as birds, monkeys, tigers, etc. I visited at around 12 nn so it was rather hot. Best to visit earlier or later in the day. I would suggest better signs to indicate the location of the other animals in the park. Cages for animals could be a little bit bigger, although the crocs are fine.   For a first time visitor to Davao, I would recommend a visit.   There is a nice restaurant across the street from the Park that serves good grilled dishes including crocodile meat.

ReviewTitle: Brutal... I wouldn’t recommend Crocodile Park
Review: We visited Crocodile Park on December 26th and it was appalling seeing the way the animals are kept.  I'm always shocked by the way most Asian places keep their animals which are often beyond the proper conditions, especially space-wise. It would be like keeping people in a 3x3 cell without a chance of going out to the yard ever in their lives.  Indeed it's true what's been said: Crocodile Park has more animals than only crocodiles. Nevertheless, the conditions they are kept are terrible. Most of the birds are locked inside cages they cannot spread their wings and the tiger's exercise area is not enough for a human being to practice jogging – much less a tiger. The giant crocodile was kept in a pound only a little bigger than its own body. I believe the park should either expand the area the animals are kept and the aviary should be way larger. The tigers should have enough space for their exercise and the crocodiles should be kept on better conditions – people should know that only feeding and cleaning is not enough.

we visited this on Wednesday 23rd January 2014, plenty to see including the tigers and the highlight the Orang Utan , but to say they were kept in good conditions would not be true , the tigers looked thin , I found it sad but that is my personal view , still the rest was worth a vist

ReviewTitle: Good Place to Go With Kids
Review: Not just about crocodiles. Ostriches can be seen near the entrance. And there are a number of snakes, sheep, tigers, and many other animals. Our favorite place was the Dragon's Den which featured rabbits (and turtles and fish but the rabbits were so cute!) There are shows in the afternoon around 4 pm.  They offer a package deal with an Indigenous People's outdoor exhibit and a butterfly garden. Neither are worth it. Just go for the Crocodile Park.

I was not expecting there are others animals in the park. Not just ordinary animals we saw everywhere but the rare ones. But you will spend thousand pesos for the entrance when you go there with you family.
Loved it ... Hugh crocodiles ... one the largest in the World. family fun, easy to get to and nice way to spend an afternoon.

This is a huge park with other animals than crocodiles. But really marked on me is the crocodile show at around 5pm. It is fascinating to see the crocodile "dance" as they jump to reach their food from the trainer. Nice place for the little kids.

This place is called Crocodile Park but offers more. They had a variety of big snakes there, birds, monkey, a very huge crocodile, etc. It is not a huge place but I would recommend going there if in Davao City.

Just average, seen this kind of park too many times Just some crocs lying around, and some added bird cages and a couple of sad looking orangutans The photo session with the snake and the baby croc is ok  But a steep 200 p entrance fee

I can't understand why it costs 200 pesos ($4.70) to enter this little park. Manila Zoo is bigger and houses lots more animals than this zoo... its entrance fee is a little less than a dollar.   Civet coffee and ice cream made with crocodile eggs are sold here.

Been to other crocodile farms in Australia, Indonesia & FL for comparison. An honest attempt to portray a croc farm and should be encouraged to show Davao's geographic diversity. However, due to the variety of animals here, suggest to reconsider a name change. Additionally, found the shop interesting in that Civet coffee was located at a price that I was willing to pay for!

I have visited the crocodile park a few times basically to take my extended family, on my visits to Davao. It is small but interesting,..in saying that, I am not a fan of the small enclosed cages. As a member of OFI, I found the Orangutan cage not really suitable as there is lack of things for the primate to do, however, I was lucky to be there on feeding and the keeper did an excellent job and the food was really appropriate for their diet - congrats! You do not mind paying an entrance fee and for photos etc if you know the animals are treated well. Overall. a lovely visit.

This is a chance to get up close to the crocodile and learn a little about wildlife. There are other animals monkeys, birds etc. This a place for people who like to see wild animals. This is an outdoor facility and like the Philippines will be hot. It was a nice little trip.

This plCe has plenty of crocs, ostriches, birds of variety kinds, and other animals. They let u feed moderate size crocs using a bamboo stick and there is a viewing of a large size croc feeding a pig how it comes out of the water eats a portion of the big before going back on the water. There are croc shows but it's cool for the most part for the fee.

ReviewTitle: Just went to Crocodile Park for the first time
Review: Not a whole lot to do but a pleasant experience. Saw two tigers, fed some ostriches and saw hundreds of crocs. Ate a nice lunch in the end. Enjoyable.

This place is teeming with all sorts of animals, they should consider renaming it to "Davao Zoo"..hahahaha I'm not complaining and the entrance fee was worth it. Make it a point to go there on weekends since the shows that start from 4pm onwards are worth the wait!

I'm so glad that I convinced our group to come here. Everyone had a great time! All of the animals were kept in a humane manner. Excellent and friendly staff ready to serve and management is obviously professional and up to date with current standards. Highly recommended!

Just your common zoo with different species of animals. There are also food like crocodile ice cream, croc sisig, etc. However, there is nothing memorable to eating those I guess. This place is great for kids, and there are also other attractions nearby.   How I wish there are lot of reminders how we could take care these animals and not just stare and eat them.

ReviewTitle: Have to try to croc meat.
Review: Tiny zoo, since they have other animals, I think entrance is 100 or 200 peso. You see tons of crocs waiting to be slaughtered for meat and leather use. Their cafe that serves croc products are ok, mind you they are a cafe and not a fine dining resto. They just slap the meat in a grill and 450 peso please....or if you think you can handle a ostrich omelette at 1000 peso, equals to eating 20 eggs i think...It cost that much cause you wasted a good ostrich that would of made them 50,000 when its adult size.
great zoo in davao,was way much better then the one i have visited in manila... great place too.. and the fee was not that bad. worth to visit

During my visit to Davao we made a stop at Crocodile Farm/Park, its a good place, we went during the week in the morning so it was quiet. Not much feeding or anything but the amount of Crocs on display is impressive and there is...More

it's a great place especially for kids and animal lovers. my favorite part was when we were petting baby tigers, snakes & baby crocodiles.also, watching the feeding of crocodiles was pretty fun especially with the largest in the zoo named pangil. there are a number...More

Going to the Crocodile Park is a family adventure. The younger kids will love it. And as a family everyone will enjoy the day. There are shows with birds, tigers and crocodile's (of course). As the attractions are outdoors it will be warm so dress...More

ReviewTitle: Outside the city, but worth it
Review: The only problem with visiting the crocodile park is that it is outside the city and taxis are scarce there. We just took a taxi and negotiated with the driver, meter plus 200 pesos per hour waiting. Expensive but worth it. As for the park...More

All my kids have visited Crocodile Park a number of times. It's the first for me and my husband. It is actually just 20 to 30 minutes drive from downtown Davao.One can easily get there with a taxi. the Entrance fee is P150.00 for adults...More

the main attraction was this giant crocodile which IMHO looked super duper depressed and lonely. this is the last time i'm ever voluntarily going to a zoo/park with animals. the animals here didn't look happy at all and some of them seemed dirty and underfed....More

The Crocodile Park is actually a zoo housing many other animals. Make sure you visit the crocodile park during the feeding time. We arrived at the park before 4pm, just in time for the feeding frenzy of the small crocodiles (with pieces of chicken) and...More
A great place to visit if you take children or wish to bring back childhood memories , lots of animals to see and places to eat , nice gardens and well laid out !

ReviewTitle: Average, but the tribal fire dance is a must see!
Review: Although it's called a crocodile park, you see several other animals there, like ostriches, Bengal tiger, parrots, binturong, Philippine brown deer etc., most of which are in distressingly small cages, barring the ostriches, which have a fairly large running area. It's tragic to see the three tigers confined to a tiny enclosure, though some of the staff were trying to invite visitors (for a price) to climb onto a ramp for a 'view from top' of the tiger enclosure, though there were very few takers. The crocs themselves seem to fade into the background in view of all the other activities going on around the park. One of them is rather huge. One thrilling feature is a couple of Filipino chaps doing tricks on a tight rope right above a tank full of dangerous, large crocs. Apart from 'standing on one leg' and dances performed on the tight rope, to the accompaniment of recorded disco music, the chaps drew several gasps from a shocked audience when they pretended to slip and fall into the tank. It gets bloody crowded around the show though, so get to the show early and get places right in front. Small pavilion like stepped seating is also around, but it's pretty much useless with the hundreds standing and crowding about in front. Behind this pavilion are several enclosures housing scores of crocodiles. The best part of the croc park however is the tribal fire dance performed by professional dancers in costume. These are apparently traditional folk dances performed by the Tribu K Mindanawan tribals. The many dangerous stunts they perform with fully lighted kerosene torches and fire frames will leave you spell bound for several tense minutes! There are photo ops apelnty after the show as the dancers allow you to take pictures with them while they are still holding their burning torches. Only ignore the kerosene fumes and the smoke! All restaurants in the park serve crocodile sisig, a stew like local filipino dish made with croc meat. Fairly tasty.
Today I get my second positive surprise here. Nice little zoo,and here was very clean compare about the zoo in Subic. Price 150 P also fair, so in all a nice place.

ReviewTitle: It's definitely not just about crocs. :)
Review: The Crocodile Park is located inside the Davao Riverfront Corporate City. And it's actually a mini-zoo because there are other animals there like birds, deers, monkeys, snakes, etc.   On weekends, they have the bird show, crocodile show. There's also a fire dance show at the Tribu K'Mindanawan Cultural Village (which we enjoyed immensely), just a few steps away from the Crocodile Park.   It's best to arrive at the place 2pm or 3pm on a weekend. Have a look around the zoo first, check out their Butterfly House. The bird, crocodile and tightrope walking shows start at 4pm. The awesome fire dance show starts at 5:45pm. Entrance fees are Php 200 for adults, and Php 100 for children under 13 years old.
They look friendly to me! Aside from crocodiles, you have lots of other things to do in this park. Educational and relaxing....

The zoo's ok for kids in their preschool or early gradeschool age. I've been to better zoos... The zoo is clean and spacious but the crocs were not really exciting to see. You know crocs they don't really move much...
seen an old anzoo? then go and see this one, animals in old cages, and because of the heat sometimes very smelly

The owner invited us to see his park but unfortunately he wasnt able to accompany us during the rest of the tour. So we found our way in. There is a tour with human (performer) close encountering with the crocs.-it was fun watching it. It made us aware of the crocs behavior but what is more fun about the tour is when they start presenting us the products coming from the crocodile. we bought these healing enzymes coming from crocs that make wounds heal fast. There are also a shopping areas where you can find good stuffs as souvenirs. =)

ReviewTitle: kids had fun at crocodile park
Review: It was more of a zoo since they have tigers, snakes, monkeys, birds, crocodiles, etc. kids had fun. We also got to taste civet coffee!
it was a fairly small park. the fun here is taking a photo with a big yellow snake. for 40 pesos you can sit with the snake and have your photo taken.
This place is disappointing and is close to what I see as animal cruelty. The whole place is outdated and could seriously need a big renovation. As the title says its not worth visiting.

Been to other crocodile parks but i can say Davao's the best. The place is clean and well-maintained. Animals are properly cared. Lots of animals compared to other parks. You get a chance to get closer with the crocodile, python, birds, orangutan or even the...More

ReviewTitle: Boring - save your time & money for something else . . .
Review: Since our friend had plenty of free vouchers, we headed over to the Croc park for about an hour. The only thing they had going for them was the 15-min. feeding "show", we're they dangled some meat for the crocs to jump up and grab,...More
i enjoyed the animal show. there are other animals also.not only crocodile. they have monkey, parrots, snakes, leopard cat, etc the kids will surely love to visit this place.

With the mysterious death of Lolong, the world's largest crocodile in captivity, people start becoming curious about this reptile. Don't look now, there's a park built for them in Davao City. You'll see all sizes and shapes of crocs here, plus so much more animals....More

It’s a lot more than just a crocodile park. I would call it a small zoo. They have snakes, Burmese python, ostriches, eagles, birds, apes, and tigers and of course a huge amount of crocodiles of every variety and shape and size. It’s not a...More
Enjoyed the wild encounter and the shows especially the fire dancers. Recommended for families with kids
i like all the animals in crocodile park,specially the snakes... i love the view and i also love their ice cream.....

I have never seen so many Crocs in one place.. absolutely enjoy the few hours I spent here - so many people in the park at the time I visited so validates it's attraction. A definitely must see & I will be going back

ReviewTitle: Riding on Bike, Cruising on a Highway
Review: I followed the advise of a local hire a ride on a motor bike to get there. The driver was young so we got speed. A bit fun for me who has never been on a motor bike ride - on a highway. Didn't expected much since crocs won't move much even how loud you yell at them. Got a little bit sad when restaurant ran out of fresh crocs to serve. But that saved me a lot of money too. But nice people are always around. There's this burger lady who was also selling frozen Croc sisig! She was kind enough to consider my request to cook the meat for me. Without asking for any charge. Of course, she was happy when she received her tip. And yes for desert - vanilla ice cream with crocodile egg! Nice to take pics of the crocs, coz they don't fly away. Toilets are well maintained. Well, on the way back there are taxis waiting, but who wants them when there are motor bikes around! Weeeeee!
This is the best place for crocs lovers. Nothing unique inside. You'll see different species of crocs, love birds, ostrich, turtle, reptiles and monkey

I was expecting just a park with croccidles but it was full of many animals including siberain tigers. Its very good value for your money and is a great place to bring kids for a few hours. I highly reccomend you go however right before 3pm and wait for the 4pm show. That was the best part by far of the whole experience.

The grounds were nice and the Crocs well displayed however the condition and living areas of the other animals left a lot to be desired . the tigers were in cages barely big enough for a domestic cat let alone a magnificent tiger it needs a lot of work to bring it up to international standard .
I enjoyed the visit. The place was small and it didn't take long to see all the attractions. I was expecting to see more exibits

Visit this place specially during Friday and saturday late afternoon as they have firedance and cultural dance seeing them for free is a plus.  The name speaks for its place really plenty of crocs here, small, med, to large, snake, ostrich, orangutan, and tiger are visible in the are plenty of animals here so many to mentions, good thing in this place if you pay for the entrance of 150 you have 3 places to visit the 1)croc park,  2)the tribu k which showcase the different native houses of Mindanao tribes, and also there are different tribe who are visible and explain their culture if you wish special if you go to the pasalubong area the ladies who use to sell their are ginuine natives of Mindanao they have matigsalog, manobo, t'boli, bagobo, mans aka, mandaya, and many more.  3)You can visit also the butterfly garden which is just nearby the place and part of the 3 place that allows you to visit while you are here. They have also nearby resto the river walk grill which offer the exotic food such as croc sisig, ostrich meat, and native delicacies.
its not just the crocodiles but there area lot of animals that you can showcase to your kids to expand there knowledge about animals tis is one good place for you and kids to have fun along

You can see baby crocodiles to teenage crocs to adult crocs and even a grandfather or grandmother crocs. One of the best educational place for students even for tourists as well. You can feed the crocodiles- just ask for the assistance. You can have a picture together with the baby crocodile, or with the yellow snake. The place is wide and there are other animals to see, restaurants to eat, and souvenir shops. Want to try to eat an Ostrich Egg Omelet? You can try to eat in one of the Restaurants located inside the crocodile park.

visited this place with my friends. Loved this awesome place with different type of wild animals. We enjoyed taking pictures for every animals in the park. And hey! I enjoyed watching the Tribal Dance Show. It was awesome.

Very interesting place that has crocodiles of every size lounging around by the pools. Also has Siberian tigers, ostriches, birds, Burmese pythons, turtles, goats and even rabbits. Great place to visit and educational.

ReviewTitle: tiny zoo with a LOTTA crocs
Review: Aside from 70 crocs, there's a couple of tigers, around 10 different kinds of birds, lizards, snakes, and a monkey. i guess i shouldn't complain... it is, after all, a crocodile park.

ReviewTitle: Wonderful Wildlife + Convenience + Great Food Selection
Review: Undoubtedly the best zoo in Davao, despite it's size. (Of course, zoos in Manila are bigger.) However, their animal repertoire is still impressive, and you can really see that the animals are well taken cared of. What's more, booking and group reservations are convenient, and...More

We went at Crocodile Park in Davao last September 15, 2012 as a part of our field trip. I found the place clean. There are lots of crocodiles, birds and reptiles. Though I wasn't able to watch the fire dance that night, but my classmates...More

ReviewTitle: main park great, others bit off!!!
Review: It was August 17 and Kadayawan festival is already on in the downtown of Davao, so we decided to take a little out with my visitors to nearby city attraction.... Its not way of PUJ's so for us able to save a little, we take...More

The Crocodile Farm in Davao is a very nice zoo, there are many colorful small birds when you enter and also other animals as well. they also have a tiger when i last went there. its an attraction in Davao but not much of a...More
the entrance fee seems to be a bit expensive considering the views inside which are all reptiles and some birds.

It was a great place to go to out of the city. It had only a couple of animals, but i guess for the price you cannot expect much. Basically if you want to be with nature, you could go there. They have a fantastic...More
basic Crocidile Zoo few other animlals to see also but not bad place to get away from things and also start point for water rapid ride too.
A good place to spend the afternoon with the kids, and the kids at heart. It's a typical zoo with sufficient animals. The show was good, just enough time per show that will not make you bored.

Meet Pangil, a crocodile whose clan has been existing for more than 200 million years! There's also a bird show with "excessive" audience participation. To be honest, we didn't like the way they caged the animals. The simulation of their natural habitat is poor and...More

The park's main attraction are ... Yeah.. Crocs. They also host a show aiming to make us humans aware of other living creatures around us and how we should dispose our garbage properly. They also give the animals participating in the show a bit of...More

Two of my best buddies went to this park just to experienced with the baby crocodile in our hands. It was great. I so loved it. The entrance fee is 150 pesos, Inside the park you will not only see crocodiles but you'll get to...More

Great spot to visit if you are in Davao....you get up close and personal to alot of the animals and I even got the chance to hold a huge python :) Park is clean and well kept and the staff is very friendly. The only...More
Nice zoo. Animals looked happy and great way to promote ecotourism in the Philippines.

ReviewTitle: A close encounter to live animals
Review: Crocodile park is located at the diversion road inside a FSDizon & Son's Corporate City. This place also where the Zorb Ball activity is being stationed. There are so many things that you can do to enjoy in this place because they have a clubhouse...More

I didn't enjoy much on our visit at Crocodile Park. You can see several crocodiles of different sizes and other animals. We've got to see the Feeding Frenzy show which is just basically the feeding time of young crocodiles. I think the entrance fee of...More
Great Animals Snakes Crocodiles Birds Dears and the monkeys were excelent

They have crocs in all sizes, from hatchlings to full grown ones like Pangil. They also have a collection birds, snakes, turtles, tigers, a civet, an iguana and a few mammals. There's a photobooth where you can have your picture taken with a baby croc or a huge albino boa constrictor for a minimal fee.

ReviewTitle: So many crocs and boas in this place.
Review: We went around the whole area and find the place as expected, lots of crocodile Dundee and surprisingly big snakes and other animals like, tigers, monkeys and ostrich. Lots of different types of birds too. I love the fact that we went on a Tuesday were senior citizens are free of entrance fee, my husband got in free.
Crocodile park in Davao is a nice place to visit but it is quite small though. Crocodile dancing is somewhat interesting to watch too.

We enjoyed our walk around and took a lot of pictures. I had never seen a guy walk across on a rope barefoot over a crocodile infested pool. Not just 1 guy but 2. Wow, what balance and what nerves. There's more but that was my photo of the day.

Having recently visited the Crocodile Park in PUerto Princesa, I am not impressed with the Crocodile Park located in Davao City. The entrance fee of 150 pesos is not worth the visit so my advise is to skip this attraction.  The cages where the animals are kept do not appear to be clean and smell bad. The are few crocodiles and they are smaller compared to those exhibited in Puerto Princesa.   I hope that management of this place keep the place clean both for the sake of the animals and those of the guests visiting this site.

Although it's a little dirty, I enjoyed watching the crocodiles. They keep a very huge croc name Pangil, he is awesome huge!  If you are taking kids with you it's good to give them some educational tour, explaining how these reptiles come from an egg and develop into a huge lizard. hehe,, They have their tourguide and at 4PM daily there is a bird show that everyone will enjoy.   The orangutans are also cute. You could take photos with them and a yellow boa is available for picture taking too. Just be warned it's scaly, cold and heavy. Don't freak out you might scare the snake.

Well, from the name itself, this park is full of crocodiles, small and medium ones (being locked in cages of course!). But it's surprising that it also has some animals like snakes, tigers, monkeys, ostriches and other variety of birds.  It was a nice experience though as it's not always that you see these kind of animals in the city. My wife and I enjoyed taking pictures with them. :) Nevertheless, I found it just ordinary.

It was much better than I expected. Aside from the many many crocodiles, there were so many other animals! Birds, mammals, etcetera. It was clean, not over crowded, lots of places to sit around, and snack places right outside. A holiday trip to Davao would be incomplete without a visit to the Crocodile Park.

Entrance fee is 150 pesos. You can have a photo taken with the phyton Jasper for 40 pesos. Pangil is long and huge and old ( 80 yrs old ,I think). The park is clean with few animals. You can feed the small crocodile for 35 pesos. There are small souvenir shops around the area. The best time to go there is on Fri, Sat and Sun. They have cultural shows, bird shows in the afternoon. There is a butterfly garden 300 meters from the park but not much to see.

Crocodile park needs updating. It´s pretty small, but they have some shows with natives i think which we missed, so i can´t comment on this. All in all, it was ok, but i don´t think we would go again.
As the name says it is a "croc park" but but there are many other animals to see. fairly good day and the Zorb is close by also
very well kept and healthy animals. Clean and safe. go in the afternoon when its a little bit cool. many interactive activities...good show

what i like about the crocodile park is that it is accessible for people who are just in davao for a day. i can easily bring friends there and they'd enjoy taking photos with the giant albino snake and the baby crocs. it is best...More

We already know that we would be seeing crocodiles here. It also showcases other animals including those that are exotic. They also have other fun activities like the photo booth wherein you can have your picture taken while holding an Albino Python or a young...More
The first crocodile you get to meet must be the biggest one in asia! It's huge and if you are not carefull it will get you wet. hahahah
not much to see, includes butterfly farm too, probably more to see/photo there i guess

If you come to Davao, you have to come to the Crocodile park.. I had a lot of fun. You get to take a picture with a python or Boa constrictor. Honestly, I don't know much about snakes. The picture cost 40php. You get a...More

ReviewTitle: Best adventure to feed crocs and buy souvenirs
Review: This is really a great show of wildlife animals. If possible, go and feed a crocodile and take picture or record this adventure. The prices are low, also for good home made souvenirs like coffee.

ReviewTitle: Davao Crocodile Park doesn’t only house well-cared crocs but has the presence of other exotic animal species
Review: Davao Crocodile Park doesn’t only house well-cared crocs but has the presence of other exotic animal species like raptors, monkeys, bearcats, snakes, trained birds, and other reptiles makes it one of the most desired tourist destinations in Davao Colorful birds are found around the park as well as the endangered cassowary and many other animals. is like a mini-zoo where we got to see crocodiles, of course :). There are many crocodiles in the farm plus other animals such as monkeys, birds, ostrich, parrots and even a fully-grown tiger. Pythons and snakes can also be found inside the park. We had the chance of petting them (at our own risk). The best time to see the crocodiles is during feeding time. Fortunately for us, we were able to catch feeding time, and the many scheduled shows inside the park.  We met Carlo, the super kulet chimpanzee! We also saw some breeding ponds for baby and semi-sized crocodiles. There are also other animals inside like colorful parrots..the biggest and oldest crocodile inside Davao Crocodile Park: ‘Pangil‘. Pangil I think is about 18 feet long.

ReviewTitle: Fun for Kids but could be a little scary
Review: We went here during the weekdays so we didn't really get to see the show but there were a lot of crocodiles there!!! The eagles there can be pet but their claws are so huge you will really think twice. There was also an area where you can actually have a face to face encounter with other reptiles that look like baby dinosaurs though we didn't dare to go for they run so fast. Haha.

ReviewTitle: Fun Day in Davao: A must stop destination!!!
Review: Private zoo which specializes on crocodiles, snakes and birds. This zoo is fun and pleasant. It would be 5 star if there ugly fences did not block viewing of all the animal. Super Highlight!!! at 4pm, you get to hold and take pictures with giant Burmese Boas. You will not believe it. Crocodile feeding is also a fun site, the zoo workers love their job and make this exciting.

150 pesos per person to get in. The crocs and other animals are reasonably well cared for compared to other places in PI. Try the durian ice cream. We liked the native village with traditional dwellings but could not find the butterfly farm after looking for it for a long time.

ReviewTitle: Lot's of things to see and do
Review: Crocodile Park isn't just about crocodiles. It's like a mini zoo with different species of birds, reptiles, snakes and some mammals too! It's really fun! And just for P150 each person, you would have access to the Crocodile Park, Butterfly House and the Tribe Park. It's well worth it! Too bad we missed the show because we came in the morning.

ReviewTitle: this is an educational park too
Review: Davao Crocodile Park is a well-maintained park. You cannot see just a crocodile/s here but also some other animals like big snakes, birds, etc. Surely children will enjoy in this place and learn about these animals.

It’s a 30-minute drive from Gaisano Mall. You can only reach the park through taxis or private vehicles. On the way to the park, you’ll pass by a zorv ball site which is also open to the public for a fee. It’s similar to the zorb ride in Dahilayan Park, Bukidnon, where you ride the zorb ball that’s to be pushed downhill. I guess your hands and feet are also strapped into the zorb ball’s interior as you do the ride.  Entrance to Crocodile Park is P 150.00 per person on a weekday and P300.00 per person on weekends. Don’t be misled by the name of the park, the park is actually a zoo which houses almost all types of animals, but the main attraction are the crocodiles. Expect that most visitors are families and schools on educational trips. One thing that I can say about the park is that it’s clean and well-maintained. You can go in and out of the park as long as you have your hand stamped at the entrance gate. Policemen/ security personnel are also visible to maintain peace in order. I’m not a big fan of zoos, though.

Of course the crocodile did not attack us but we were very much excited to see them. I went there with someone who has not yet seen a crocodile in action. You can see birds, eagles, parrots, snakes not only pure crocodiles. We tried to go near the eagle to take a picture since it was open and the people were gone but when we said smile, the eagle tried to jump on me and so I ran (An eagle with an attitude). There's this show wherein a man will walk in a hanging line above the crocodile pool (IT SUPER CRAZZY!) there came a time that he actually fell and the staff had to hurry and help him or else it's dinner time :)  After the tour in the farm, we went to watch a show about all the natives of Mindanao (to see their culture is wonderful, especially the clothes) there's games and trivia questions and plenty of dances. A must see! In the restaurant you can eat crocodile meat! Try it, it's nice and doesn't taste like crocodile at all! (one exotic food am willing to eat)

We arrived at around 330 pm which was quite ideal because it was not so hot in the area. The entrance fee was P200 from 2 pm onwards. Inside were different types of animals, and not just crocodiles.   At 4:00 pm, there was an eco-show wherein they sort of paraded the animals that were considered the main attractions of the park. This was not simply a show where they made the animals perform, but it was informative that it included how to identify the animals, how to take care of them, and how they are continuously being threatened by the society's unreserved invasion of their shelters. They consider the animals as ambassadors of the environment, as they represent the green environment that is Davao City.  By the end of the show, there was a tightrope act of two men over a cage full of crocodiles. The first man was successful in crossing the rope, the second almost failed, wherein he almost fell to the waters. It was a really terrifying stunt which people from the audience either wished that the man really fell or the whole act was totally unnecessary.  The one-hour show ended with more photo-ops with the animals as well as a tour of the other places of the park. It is well-maintained, but it demands support from the public as well that after the experience, we may have a better appreciation of the animals and nature.

ReviewTitle: a real shame for all these unfortunate animals
Review: we visited this park, which is hardly a park, and were saddened by the conditions there. the crocodile pens are practically dry, but for a little filthy disgusting algae crusted water in them...even the breeding tanks look dirty and poorly maintained. the commercials for this place paint an entirely different picture. the rest of the poor birds and other animals are cramped into tiny wire meshed cages that they can barely move in and get tormented by stupid, uneducated visitors. we especially felt sorry for the tigers there, kept in a caged area better suited for a small dog rather than 2 full sized beautiful animals such as these.  this place is small, dirty and overcrowded with little real attention given to the animals there except to make money. if this place were in a first world country it would be shut down by animal rights groups in about 5 minutes. i also find it offensive and discriminatory that foreigeners are charged double to enter cheap circus attractions such as these. i happen to be a foreigner and also a resident of the philippines, so i escape this discrimination, but it's always amazing to witness this ridiculous standard. also something you would never see in a first world country. stay clear of crocodile park...you won't be missing a thing.

ReviewTitle: Everything at once! The best attraction in Davao.
Review: The Crocodile park compound has everything at once. Before you arrive in the Crocodile Park you can try the Davao Zorb park which is owned by the same franchise. You can also try a water Zorb (great for little kids!) on a pond they have nearer to the park. Water Zorb is free with Zorb purchase.. There is also a butterfly park in the compound as well, although I have not visited that yet! The crocodile park itself is very cool, it also has birds that can sit on your arm, and other animals like ostrich and civets, to name a few! I loved it.. it was entertaining and well maintained. They also had crocodile shows! They have a small restaurant where I heard you can eat crocodile meat, and I believe they even have some kind of garden with dragon fruit trees, but I did not see it yet because I heard it's new.

What can I say about this place, its no Singapore zoo but what they have is good. When we visited it was a Wednesday and we didn't see anyone past the the main entrance, not even staff so it was like we had the park to ourselves! There are a good variety of animals there and you can get right next to them which is something I've never been able to do. Seriously you could touch the Pythons if you were brave enough (not recommended!) Anyway its not a huge place but good for a hour or so. On certain days they put on a show involving the crocs and other animals which we missed but I hear is very good. Outside the park is the riverside walk where you can get a drink or crocodile steak (if you wish?) and is a nice place to finish the day.   Overall I would say if your in Davao, give this place a visit. Its not going to keep you busy the whole day but is certainly good for a couple of hours. Well done to the staff.
Ive been to the crocodile farm twice, sunday afternoons for the 4:30PM show. Its been memorable and a great place to relax.

ReviewTitle: It was interesting, a must see:)
Review: This park is a really nice place and I did enjoy my visit to the Crocodile Park near Davao. I have visited it in December 2005 when they have been moving the old park to a new location. Anyway, it was fun to see these big crocodiles from so close distance. I expected the park to be bigger though, they have put some other animals as well there, so it looks like a small zoo. The only thing I didn't like is when I saw some small chicken waiting in the cages of the huge snakes to be eaten by the big reptiles.I would recommend you guys to visit it - it's one of the main attractions in Davao!
